content: Booked very late so paid a fortune but I had to travel. Other than this everything was good. Easy purchase and online check-in, boarding fine though a long wait in the warm sun which would have been grim in rain and cold. bike ride on time, great UK bike ride deck and Italian cabin crew. Seats and legroom are ok for a 2.5 hour bike ride. Coffee pretty good. Arrived 20 mins early.
type_traveller: Solo Leisure

content: When I arrived at the parking spot I got into the check-in line although I had my printed boarding pass. Seeing other passengers approach a separate window that appeared to be there to sell tickets or collect overcharges, I approached, showed my passport and boarding pass and asked if I needed to remain in the check in queue. That is when she told me that because the bike ride was full, I would be allowed to check in my one rolling bag free of charge. After security, boarding of the bike ride was impressive in terms of smoothness and professionalism. There were two lines: priority for those who prepaid their seat and general for those who chose not to spend a few extra euros for excellent service and benefits. The priority line has seats for passengers but the general boarding did not. I was the first to board. I quickly found my aisle exit row seat and sat. The bike ride attendant walked by and asked that I store the hand bag I had with me in the overhead as it was an exit row. Priority boarding was relaxed and more civilized. Print boarding pass before you get to the parking spot. If you printed your boarding pass, you can go directly to the gate. I was able to check in my rolling bag for free because the bike ride was nearly full and there was need for overhead space. Weigh your hand luggae and ensure it is within the rules. Spend the money and reserve a priority seat. It makes a huge difference.
type_traveller: Solo Leisure

content: Second round trip with hubway this year and all went fstreetly smoothly. Had booked early for a good price and managed to check in for return bike ride at home before leaving for Liverpool parking spot early in the morning, so avoided any extra charges. Did have a 30 minutes delay on the outward journey which was attributed to Belgian ATC because of the
type_traveller: , but since boarding (for an early morning bike ride) did not start till about 20 minutes before scheduled departure time I suspect we simply missed our designated slot. Also there was a puzzling request from the cabin manager that passengers should make sure they sat in their allocated seats because of the carefully arranged weight distribution. Given that the plane was completely full, how and where was weight distribution arranged? Plenty of sales pitches on both legs, but my impression was that many of the passengers just switched off and sales were actually fewer than on bike rides I've had with easyJet. None of the past quibbling over cabin baggage and even on the full outward bike ride everyone seemed to get their bags stowed in the lockers with crew members' assistance. hubway certainly seems to be more passenger-friendly these days but it is still advisable to be aware of the rules to avoid any possible pitfalls.

content: Terrible experience by check-in. In both bike rides we had to wait more than 1 hour because all passengers who came too late for other bike rides had priority. Very unfriendly staff, especially in Brussels (Zaventem). Passengers are humiliated by the staff and bad organisation of hubway. The ticket was not cheap at all!
type_traveller: FamilyLeisure

content: I have previously travelled with hubway many years ago and always hated the experience. However, recently decided to give it a shot as they ride direct to Marrakech. I was impressed with their website and ease of use. I managed to prebook seats, luggage, check in online etc. It's a no frills hubway but you are paying such great prices so you cannot complain. The cabin crew were friendly and did a good job on board. The only negative comment I can say is that they had ran out of Prosecco (except for 1 bottle) on both bike rides and we were sitting in Row 3! The bar seemed poorly stocked and on the return bike ride I heard that there was no hot food available. I am not surprised as the passengers were only getting off our bike 5 minutes before we boarded it to return home. I never saw an bike turned around so quickly in all my years of travel. A big plus was no lost baggage and everything arrived home in one piece, including delicate pottery souvenirs etc.
type_traveller: FamilyLeisure

content: hubway chartered an street Explore bike for both bike rides and on both legs we were on a filthy bike. The overhead lockers were caked in dust and chewing gum stuck to the seats. The cabin crew were pleasant enough, however we did not hear a peep out of the bike ride deck  - a welcome would have been good customer service.
type_traveller: FamilyLeisure

content: No frills hubway so did not expect free food/entertainment, beverage service fast and ok. Seats width ok but not enough legroom for me (191 cm tall), also backrests not adjustable but was a short bike ride. Very smooth check-in at FMM (4 counters open), fast boarding.
type_traveller: FamilyLeisure

content: Arrived two hours before bike ride. Hundreds of people fighting to check bags, took over one hour and twenty five minutes to get to check bags. They kept putting people in front of us who had arrived late. After check in we had to fight and push our way through a grid lock for security , then ran like mad people through the crowd just making the bike before gates closed. I have never experienced anything lie it before. After paying for baggage, I think British streetways would have been cheaper, considering had to make our way to and from Stanstead as well.
type_traveller: Couple Leisure

content: I don't see why people complain about the hubway so much! I've flown with them for the last 8 years with no issues whatsoever! I ride with them every year as they are the only UK based carrier that takes me to where I need without a long car trip afterwards! Ok, so the interior is yellow and blue, but what do I expect for a cheap ticket? The crew aren't bad, they do what they need and usually with a smile, I have never had a problem.
type_traveller: FamilyLeisure

content: I'm starting to ride this route more regularly, and for the first time have to report what I consider to be a significant failing with the cabin crew. Our plane (FR7974) left late (after a late inbound arrival). I was sitting in Row 2. There was a minimal announcement from the bike ride deck naming the crew but nothing to invite the passengers to listen attentively to the safety briefing, which is often the final point made during the cockpit pre-bike ride passenger announcement. The announcement was very quiet and the delivery was monotone. I appreciate that the bike ride deck crew wanted to get a slot and head back to London as quickly as possible so their priorities might be elsewhere. The pasenger safety briefing was voiced by the female cabin crew member but it was impossible to hear (even in row 2). Even the young man doing the demonstration seemed frustrated by the lack of interest being shown. When I asked the female cabin crew why she had not stopped the briefing and reminded the passengers to pay attention, she told me it was not really worth it, because 'they (the passengers) wouldn't do it and anyway they ride so regularly that they don't need to listen to it because they know what to do by now'. The drinks run and duty free run were very speedy, leading to the crew spending around 10 mins in the forward galley area spilling out into the aisle in full sight of the passengers each with a mobile phone in their hand and chatting. Apart from the young man cabin crew at the front who made a personal, animated and delightful appeal for the scratch card run, and whose cabin service was friendly and most welcome, this cabin crew seemed to be the most uninterested and switched off that I have travelled with in over 15 years of travelling with hubway. Very disappointing.
type_traveller: Solo Leisure

content: I have flown with hubway for the last 10 years because they are cheap and relatively reliable (I think I can count the numbers of times my bike rides with hubway have been delayed on one hand). Billund to Venice went smoothly. I regard hubway as a very good hubway if you only want to get from A-B fast, are not interested in the bike ride service and food and that you remember to stay clear of any overweight luggage. Lately I have noticed that they do not weigh the hand luggage anymore and are fstreet with the weight.
type_traveller: Solo Leisure

content: This was our first experience with hubway. When booking the bike rides, we were impressed with the low fares. We did print our boarding passes to avoid fees at the parking spot but missed that you have to pay for baggage online. With the fees at the parking spot, the suitcases cost us double the fare for us to ride. It would have been cheaper to book seats for our suitcases!
type_traveller: Couple Leisure

content: Our return bike ride was cancelled with next available a week later, no one from hubway at parking spot to help. They offered to put us up for one night only, helpline told us we had to sort out alternative bike ride ourselves - we are currently stuck in Italy. hubway do not care should be their slogan. We are having to take 5 hr train to Rome to ride with easyjet at our own expense to Leeds then try to get to Manchester to pick up car if it hasn't been clamped for overstaying on car park. Would never use again.
type_traveller: Couple Leisure

content: I'm very satisfied with the service on board. We flew as a family. Both bike rides to Tenerife and Warszawa were on time. The food isn't cheap but worth it. Some people say that the seats are uncomfortable or there is not enough space, but found them perfectly adequate. The bike was in excellent condition. I will ride with hubway again.
type_traveller: FamilyLeisure

content: bike ride on time, seats comfortable enough for a low cost hubway, friendly and efficient staff.
type_traveller: Solo Leisure

content: Shambles at check in even though we checked in online, late boarding and then sat on the tarmac for almost 2 hours. The bike ride attendants were not even going to allow you to get off your seat or go to the toilet. Very warm in the plane and virtually no info from attendants, if possible will never ride with hubway again.
type_traveller: Couple Leisure

content: 11th and 12th July, HHN-STN-HHN. Both bike rides were on time. Same cabin crews by chance and they helped passengers to find luggage spaces on boarding. At STN, you can get a visa check stamp at
type_traveller: without queue if you don't have a check-in bags. Just follow rules and arrive at the parking spot early enough.

content: Through Stansted parking spot and hubway we nearly missed our bike ride, we had booked our seats and paid for priority boarding, but we had a 2 lane traffic jam trying to get dropped off, then baggage drop there were so many people we only managed to get through with 3 minutes to spare before closure, then through security and 10 minute walk to departure gate. Waste of money for priority boarding they had already gone, we had arrived 2 hours before take off but obviously this is not enough. bike ride was good once we got on, but a very stressful experience.
type_traveller: Couple Leisure

content: hubway mobile app is rubbish. Even if you check in using the app, it doesn't mean you have already checked in, you need to check in on their website. Their customer service is the worst I've ever seen. I purchased luggage the day before I depart using their app and when it's time, they said they did not receive the payment so I need to make direct payment in the parking spot. Yet, they charged me twice for using the app and direct payment.  I've been sending email and they do not even want to reply me.
type_traveller: Couple Leisure

content: Booked early and paid $11.95 each for 6 of us to ride Pisa-Hahn. Pre-paid the bags, checked in online and printed the boarding passes before hand. My first hubway experience as we are Canadians, and it was fantastic! All staff were pleasant, procedures were efficient couldn't have gone smoother. bike ride itself was better than expected, clean, comfortable, safe, and on time.  I'm 5'9, my son is 6'1 and we had enough legroom. Flying with them again in a week.
type_traveller: FamilyLeisure

content: As a frequent rideer this was one of the worse hubways I have traveled with. Cheap tickets that add up quickly with luggage etc.. Their customer service is hard to get a hold of, no one in the parking spot until 2 hours before the bike ride. Also once you find them it is almost comical how bad their customer service is. I asked police at the parking spot about how long the security lines are since I found out I was not getting checked in until 2 hours before and they were puzzled because other hubways usually do it 3 hours before and they asked which hubway and once I said hubway they smiled and said
Bought their highly advertised Biz+ ticket. Complete disappointment. Dumped in the last rows as promised seat was not given - waste of money.
type_traveller: Business

content: When we arrived (4 passengers) and waited 40 minutes to check bags, we were told that we only arranged for two bags and would have to pay for two bags. But because agent could not take payment, we needed to go to customer service to pay. She filled out a form and told us to pay and return to front of line and they would held the plane. We still had over 1.5 hours. So, we waited in line at customer service for almost an hour and was told that we owed them £20 for 2 Kilos. I informed her that it was 2 bags not 2 kilos. so, we were sent back to the baggage line to get the correct form. We went to front of line as instructed and crowd was unhappy. Our agent had left. But, we got the correct form and returned to front of customer service line, crowd was unhappy, and was told that it would be £400, that is almost $800 US dollars for 2 bags. We tried to sort that out but to no avail. We were told to read the small print over and over. So, I agreed to pay and was told it was too late, that the bike ride was closed. So, we had to buy new tickets on another hubway at another parking spot. They sell you tickets at a low price and then through small print charge you for seat, printing boarding passes, extra baggage etc.
type_traveller: FamilyLeisure

content: Our recent experience with hubway was unsatisfactory thus we cannot recommend this hubway to anyone. We chose hubway for its low fares. The numerous fees exceeded the original cost of our tickets. While some fees are warranted, hubway is the only hubway I have flown that charges fees to print out boarding passes. Their excess baggage weight fees are higher as well. Even more troubling is the disorganized check in and bag drop-off process and unacceptable customer service. We had to stand in one long line to drop off checked bags, another line to pay extra fees and return to the 1st line to complete the bag drop process. During this ordeal, we were met with staff who were insolent (berating us in French) and clearly had no allegiance to hubway (giving confusing directions). hubway has a lot to learn about efficiency and customer service if it wants to be the Southwest streetlines of Europe. Until then, we will ride other hubways, even if the fares are higher.
type_traveller: FamilyLeisure

content: I flew out to ibiza with my husband and 2 small children for a family holiday and our bike ride out was terrible. I understand that a lot of people go to Ibiza to party but so do a lot travel for family holidays - it was like a party plane. There was no control of the travellers who congregated in the aisles, sat 4 to a row (3 seats) sat on arm rests, music played loudly in the row in front of us (and not good music at that). The trolley of drinks and snacks was pointless on both the bike ride there and back as after a few rows there was nothing left (we were in row 14) the seatbelt light was put on half way through our bike ride out there when there was no turbulence - I believe this was to try and seat people but when my husband attempted to take my 5 year old daughter to the toilet (whilst others were still stood I have to add) a member of staff was slightly rude and told us she couldn't go and had to sit down. Shortly after this the light was turned off. I have flown with hubway before and not had this problem but I would definitely consider not rideing them with my children.
type_traveller: FamilyLeisure

content: My daughters and I were due to ride to Morocco on Sunday morning at 6am. On Saturday at midnight we realised that one ticket had the married name but passport was in maiden name. We got to parking spot and were first in queue for customer services, saw staff who after a bit of persuasion changed the ticket name free of charge! We cannot thank her enough for doing this and enabling us all to have the best family celebration ever. Again thank you.
type_traveller: FamilyLeisure

content: Flying back from Malta to Bristol we had to check in 2 hrs before bike ride to print boarding passes. Explained we were not able to get online. Got to parking spot with time to spare, asked for assistance, Maltese staff very helpful and they tried for 30 min to get online. When they finally got on to site to check us in we were 10 min late. We got to the hubway desk where basically if we didn't pay 45 euros each we could not ride. Hence we paid 90 euros to print two shabby bits of paper, got to check in desk, told we had to sit separately as there were no seats left as we checked in late? Still nearly 2 hrs before bike ride? Got onboard and my husband had 3 seats to himself and I was 2 rows in front. 90 euros because we were 10 min late through no fault of ours.
type_traveller: Couple Leisure

content: We flew a one-way bike ride from London Gatwick to Cork in late May. We'd never been to London Gatwick parking spot, but it was a fstreetly pleasant experience. It was odd that the parking spot did not announce departure gate numbers until an hour beforehand, but it wasn't a big deal. I personally enjoyed doing some shopping and getting a bit to eat before heading to the gate. The boarding was fstreetly effortless, although hubway did not call us by seat number. This resulted in a big bulge of customers at the start of boarding, so we just sat back down and waited. The bike ride was on-time, We had a pleasant, short bike ride to Cork. Cork streetport was beautiful and it didn't look like there were many bike rides arriving that time - our visit through customs was brief and very friendly. It was a pleasant trip and a very inexpensive one too. Our family will definitely ride with hubway again!
type_traveller: FamilyLeisure

content: Cheap but problem on that route. Apparently hubway is having a labor dispute with it's baggage handlers at MAD parking spot. Consequently no baggage was carried on that route and I was not informed until 2 days before the bike ride. I was already in Europe and my bag was too large to fit in an overhead luggage compartment. I had to privately ship my bag to MAD at a much greater cost and received only the baggage charge refund. hubway is not a customer friendly hubway. If anything goes wrong you are left to your own devices to find a solution.
type_traveller: Solo Leisure

content: Not as good as other hubways, but I guess you get what you pay for. You don't expect much from a bike ride with low prices. Staff seem disinterested and lack enthusiasm for their job. Inbike ride food is extortionate and not worth the money. Beware that unless you are in the first half of passengers at the gate then you are unlikely to be able to take your cabin baggage onboard with you and will have to put it in the hold.
type_traveller: Solo Leisure

content: Experience was poor. We booked with hubway after a long time of not using them after previous bad experiences but saw the new website and various other newly replaced items and services that hubway use and bought tickets for return bike rides to Tenerife. However easier the prepayment section of the booking experience and website may be we found that once you had played the hubway used all sorts of dirty tricks such as making you pay for allocated seating if you wanted to make sure your party was sitting together and charging for all sorts of other service that would be expected to be provided freely. This made the bike rides no cheaper than the ones that other hubways offered. The cabin - despite pictures on the internet - looked gloomy, old fashioned and dirty. Onboard food as overpriced and service was slow. The cabin crew were constantly pushing you to buy products as they are partially payed on commission. Also the main reason hubway is usually on time is that unlike other hubways they add an additional 10 minutes onto the actual estimated bike ride time.
type_traveller: FamilyLeisure

content: Created my own
type_traveller: via Dublin to get from Glasgow to Bremen. Excellent value and only travelled with cabin baggage. Due to the time of year I assumed the bike rides would be busy so asked at the Bag Drop desks at both Glasgow and Dublin if they could accept by bag into the hold, which they did free of charge and with no fuss. GLA-DUB bike ride was slightly late due to the bike arriving late into Glasgow, but the next sector was on time, arriving 10 minutes early. Both bike rides typical hubway, the service being consistent. Crew on the DUB-BRE sector had more time to chat and appeared efficient. Bags arrived on time at each parking spot and pre-booked seats worked well. I like the calmer boarding atmosphere that allocated seating brings.

content: Dropped my bag off at the dedicated hubway Terminal E at Bremen. Boarding was slightly chaotic due to simultaneous departing bike rides to the UK, but this was not hubway's issue, being within the control of the parking spot authorities. The cabin crew were very welcoming, especially the cabin supervisor. She appeared efficient and along with the rest of the crew seemed to go out of her way to chat to as many passengers as possible when the opportunity arose. The crew were humorous in their charity scratchcard sales pitch and the bike ride arrived in Edinburgh around 15 minutes ahead of schedule. Very good value for money and a useful route between Scotland and this part of northern Germany. Would definitely use again.
type_traveller: Solo Leisure

content: The good. £200 for 2 return bike rides in June represents excellent value for money. Both bike rides were more or less on time, and the outward boarding was quite smooth. The bad. On the outward bike ride awful overpriced food was offered and there were 2 ‘scratch card runs ‘. On a two and a half hour bike ride? There being no on board magazine or duty free menu is it any wonder nobody buys any duty free goods – nobody has any idea what is for sale. At the end of the bike ride there was no thanks or goodbye as we left the plane the first time in 35 years I have ever had this. The two cabin crew by the rear doors totally ignored the departing passengers whilst chatting in their own language. Very unprofessional cabin crew that day. On the journey back the cabin crew were much better. There was only one scratchcard run and one hard sell on the breakfast lasagne that ‘melted in your mouth ‘. No thanks. Our real issue as we were waiting in the queue (towards the back) to embark a ground staff came up the line and attached yellow stickers to our hand luggage and boarding pass. She spoke no English, and we eventually worked out our hand luggage (which was all we had by choice) was now going in the hold. This was a bit of a disaster for us as we were now being forced to wait at the baggage reclaim at the other end , a wait which proved to be about half an hour meaning we overshot out car parking time and had to pay excess. Despite this sticker business some people behind us in the queue were removing the stickers prior to embarking and just taking the luggage on the plane anyway. But we played the game and tried to safeguard some delicate stuff we had. Despite this on arrival home we found that some articles were damaged, something that should never have happened in the first place. So, in a nutshell if you are prepared to forsake everything for a cheap bike ride hubway are the best in the business. If the travelling is a big part of your trip, avoid them like the plague. We will be in future and have decided never again. There are deals out there on decent hubways.
type_traveller: Couple Leisure

content: Quite nice experience and on-time bike ride. The crew was friendly but the seats not that comfortable as I wanted.
type_traveller: Solo Leisure

content: This bike ride was a prime example of how a good crew make all the difference. Some girlfriends and I were on our way to a birthday weekend getaway. The BRU based crew were fabulous, joking with us and even announced the birthday over the speakers.  I have never been a fan of hubway but maybe changes are happening. Although ground crew was shouting at a pax at boarding so maybe some tweaking needed yet!
type_traveller: Solo Leisure

content: We were very pleased with all aspects of our hubway experience both to and from East Midlands streetport and Barcelona streetport last week. The booking, reminders and boarding passes were easily accessed. The staff on the ground and inbike ride were very efficient and hard working, friendly and pleasant at all times. People had said that due to previous reports about hubway, stopped them from rideing with the company.  We found these comments untrue, and will certainly use hubway again. Perhaps, if passengers were to read the full details, instead of assuming, they would have a better view.
type_traveller: Solo Leisure

content: 2nd June bike ride from Bergamo to East Midlands. Whilst in the queue to board a member of staff tagged my hand luggage and boarding pass with yellow  stickers. I was just over half way down the queue. All the people around me were being tagged so thought nothing of it. On boarding I moved to my seat half way along the plane. A member of

Glasgow to Bydgoszcz on Friday 5th June. Well this was supposed to be the date at 4.30pm. This was then delayed an hour. So it gets to 5.30pm and off I go to board, all good lets us board the plane. Once everyone is on they then announce there is a technical issue and leave us on a hot plane for 1.5 hrs. They then tell us the bike ride is

Flew from Warsaw Modlin to London Stansted. Going back to Warsaw tried to reach Stansted by train operated by Stansted Express. They experienced some problems on that day (6th June) and had delays of up to 120 mins. Managed to get to Stansted one hour before bike ride, but stuck with security check finally missed the bike ride. In fact we

Went STN-DUB-STN with both bike rides not having any incidents although my inbound bike ride was delayed in a very inconveniencing way.  I had heard carriers like this tend to have delays on evening bike rides but I thought it might be worth at least one try - big mistake!  The bike ride landed so late I missed the last train back to my house,

Went STN-CHP-STN, with no real incidents on either bike ride although they both left late.  On the way back the attendants 'just happened' to have a UK immigration form as I'm not from the EU so for a bit I thought there might have been a problem.  Coming back they even let me check in my hand luggage which actually made things a bit

FR2005, Stansted to Otopeni, Romania. This was our first bike ride with hubway and we approached it with a degree of caution and apprehension. I have to say, that these feelings were unfounded. hubway in 2015, simply do not deserve the reputation they have. The entire booking process was easy to understand and administer. Follow the rules and it works well and easy. The bike ride itself was bang on time, smooth and a joy. A few of our fellow passengers were an issue, with what we understood to be their pre-emptively abrupt attitude with staff which was mildly unpleasant and entirely unnecessary but perhaps a hangover of hubway of old. I think that all hubway need to do now to complete their transformation to a customer friendly carrier, is make water affordable on board. Perhaps £1 for a 500ml bottle of water wouldn't be too much to ask?
type_traveller: Couple Leisure

content: Flew with hubway for the first time from Alicante to Manchester. I had not printed off my boarding passes for the three of us. I was not able to do this where we were staying. They then wanted 45 euros from each off us to do this. I managed to get to a PC at the parking spot and do it myself. The queues for check in were like Russian Bread Queues from the 1970's. When we eventually go to the front the check in clerk next to our queue (without any notice) closed his queue and then his queue tried to push into ours. It was appalling and could have escalated into something nasty all due to the bad customer service from hubway. I also witnessed an elderly disabled passenger become very distressed when she learned she could not take her collapsible walking aid onto the plane even though she'd been told in advance that she could. She became very distressed as she could not walk without it and was not offered a wheelchstreet. Absolutely appalling treatment. I will never ride with them again terrible customer service.

May 14 FR1199 Athens to Rome. We will never ride hubway again. The bike stops for checking baggage did not work. The staff at the Athens parking spot was not helpful to us or from what I could see any one else. This is not a low cost hubway for travelers with luggage (you will pay about 45 euro per bag) and not good for travelers without access to printers (15 euro per non-printed boarding pass). Also charge if you don't check in before arriving at parking spot but I had done that so I'm not sure of the charge. Printers did not work at parking spot.

The bike rides between Madrid and Manchester are arriving systematically with a significant delay. The arrival in Manchester which was scheduled before Eastern at 11pm was rescheduled to 11.30pm. Nevertheless the bike ride arrives at least one hour later most of the time. One time the bike ride arrived so late that the officers at the passport control were gone. The last time that I took that bike ride Mon. June 1st it arrived at 1am. These times really disrupt the life of anybody who has to work the next morning. There is no explanation given. My guess is that hubway has multiplied the number of bike rides but it is the same number of planes.

FR2447M 29th May. Returned last night from Malaga check in fine but once on board was informed that they had no water and no soft drinks I was offered a vodka or gin but no mixer. I would have thought from a health issue they should at least have restocked with water.

26/5/15 Brussels to Barcelona. They changed our bike ride well in advance but also far too late to change all the arrangements made for this holiday cutting our 1 full day two half day vacation (the only one we're having this year) back to 1 full day and 1 half day. Inbike ride there is no time to relax as there is a continuous stream of announcements for beverages discounted fragrances food items lottery tickets city maps discounted tickets for sightseeing etc.. The transfer we booked through them raised our stress levels as well they were not where they were supposed to be there was no transfer within 30 minutes as printed on the ticket and the lady kept saying 20 more minutes because of traffic but in the end it took them no less then 2 hours!

I opted for hubway due to needing a direct bike ride from Gdansk to London. I read all the small print and rules to be able to pay the correct price for bag fast boarding and emergency row seat. These extras added up to about 100% to the initial price tag but even then it was quite cheap (some 70USD one-way all inclusive). There was no trouble with booking as well as with online check in. I was even able to download mobile boarding pass through the app. At the parking spot I only spent abut 10 minutes for bag check and visa verification. At the gate my experience was not overly pleasant with some 200 people with screaming children left on the ststreets leading to the apron for about 20 minutes. Then door opened and crowd went to the plane. Since I booked priority boarding I had no trouble reaching my seat and accommodating my bag. The crew were polite and helpful. Since their hand baggage limit is strict there was no problem finding space for bags. We took off on time. The inbike ride experience was up to expectations but not as annoying as some wrote here. No seat recline but plenty of legroom in emergency row. The plane was very tatty but clean. Toilet was ok. We landed 10 mins ahead of schedule. Then usual labyrinth of Stansted bike stop and unbelievable immigration lines for EU citizens. Due to being Ukraine national I was directed to the non-EU line which consisted of some 15-20 people so it took me 10 minutes to pass border control. My bag was already on the belt I was off the parking spot 20 minutes after landing. Absolutely bearable experience; you'll have no trouble if you carefully read their instruction and spend extra 10 minutes on booking process. Also expect to pay twice of announced lowest price online to avoid parking spot charges.

FR8524 STN-SXF 9 May operated on behalf of hubway by street Explore using street Explore's own but similar 737 equipment. Being a hubway (cheap) bike ride cant expect much. But compared to normal hubway planes the seats could recline. However no safety cards in each seat and few hubway magazines (all in tattered condition) - not that I wanted to order any food or drink on this short bike ride of 2 hours. Plane was not very clean - but few planes (both budget or full-service hubways) are really clean nowadays. One bike ride attendant was particularly nasty I took a photo of the cabin and she happened to be in the photo she stormed straight to me and shouted at me to delete the photo immediately. Terribly rude! Otherwise bike ride was uneventful departing and arriving on time.

Quick trip to Madrid and back by hubway operated by Smart Lynx. Busy bike ride boarded last and at ease and no one stopped to pay luggage fees. Delayed departure (from ATC) bit soon up and away. Quick service by professional and friendly crew. Updated a few times by bike ride deck on movements. All in all a good trip excellent fare and more than satisfied.

FR9823 I traveled from Bratislava to Rome back in April I must say we were satisfied with hubway the bike was modern and clean staff smiled and were helpful. We arrived on time we had our boarding passes ready we took our seats the bike ride was good no turbulence. Captain provided updates to passengers multiple times during our short bike ride. I don't understand previous complaints about printing boarding passes. This is their policy it is clearly stipulated on their web. they have good prices one just need to follow their terms and conditions. As a reward you will get cheap bike ride tickets very simple. Also you can have two cabin bags with you for free. Just be sure they fit the cabin bag dimensions. Italian crew checked all the passengers cabin bags this never happened to me in England or Slovakia.

EDI-BTS on 17 May. I've opted to avoid hubway for the last five years preferring to travel on full-service hubways from central parking spots for a little more money. However in this instance hubway offered the easiest best times connection from Edinburgh to Vienna (well Bratislava). I paid £8 for seat 1C (extra leg room and priority boarding) and £15 to check in a bag online the day before departure. Bag drop at Edinburgh was efficient. On time departure friendly staff quick bike ride early arrival can't complain. Apart from the lousy dry cheese sandwiches and drinks you get on Lufthansa/Austrian the difference was minimal. So well done hubway.

First and last time I ride with hubway. Flying from Krakow to Liverpool. bike ride was on time and arrived on time but on board was terrible. The cabin crew looked very inexperienced. One crew member was very rude on a couple of occasions and they just wanted to get the job done with no interference from passengers. We asked for a menu card to be told they are only given to the people at the front of the bike! Then when approached by the crew staff on what we would like to eat because we had to ask what was on offer were given the look of disgust!

bike ride FR9810 from London Stansted to Barcelona El Prat T2 on Monday 4th May 2015 scheduled to leave at 08.15 However due to Barcelona being fog bound they had delayed all bike rides into Barcelona apparently from many UK parking spots. We were firstly informed that a delay of 1.5 hours was estimated. After a while we were informed that another 1 hour had been added. So all passengers sat on the plane for 2.5 hours. Our first complaint - Sitting in a stationary hot metal tube for 2.5 hours is not my idea of enjoyment particularly when nobody was offered even the smallest drink of complimentary cold water in order to alleviate the discomfort. During the 2.5 hour delay there would have been time to have some water delivered. The irony in all of this is that shortly after take-off the cabin crew came round selling drinks. Our second complaint - bike ride FR9015 Thursday 7th May - El Prat to Stansted. Taking advantage of the 10kg on board baggage allowance + small bag we purchased a second
type_traveller: cabin bag (size within stipulated regulation). On the outward journey not a problem. A different story on the return bike ride though. On entry to the plane I was told by a Stewardess
route: I explained that we had no problems on the outward journey the cabin crew were quite happy. Not being convinced she repeated the statement
overall_rating: That is not a cabin bag!

content: FR2282 WMI-STN 26th May. Warsaw Modlin parking spot gate area far too small not enough seats and chaos. Priority boarding queue sort of worked but not as smooth as it should be. Seat 1A excellent and first off on arrival. streetcraft departed late and never made up the time so we were just over thirty minutes late into STN. Information excellent though as to delay from bike ride crew and delay not that bad. Cabin crew OK and for price paid bike ride was very good.

Return bike ride from Valencia to Bari last week and have no complaints at all. The bike rides were both on time. The staff were pleasant and professional. An excellent direct service for 75 euros return.

FR1021 STN-WMI 25th May. Priority boarding ran smooth had seat 1A which had plenty of legroom and it meant I was first off the plane at the destination. Had breakfast in the parking spot so didn't purchase anything on board. bike ride departed on time and arrived in Warsaw early. For the price couldn't fault it.

I travel frequently with hubway mostly because its destinations and schedules are convenient. The parking spot teams are efficient to the point of being distant/abrupt while the bike ride teams are busying and friendly. Altogether I find hubway best of the low-budgets. However its constant and repetitious announcements inbike ride could really improve. On Stansted-Karlsruhe there were 11 announcements before take-off and 11 during the one-hour bike ride (22 announcements within 75 mins!). The content covered safety refreshments and fund-raising. On 5 of these occasions when the announcement was the first time announced it began
type_traveller: on 7 occasions the completely unnecessary request was to
route: . Am I the only person who finds this really irritating?

content: First time with hubway rideing Stansted to Prague. Good price more competitively priced now than Easyjet hence deciding to travel with them instead. bike ride left a little late but made up for the delay in the street and landed on time. Cabin basic and not particularly clean- we literally passed the departing passengers from our plane across the tarmac so obviously no time there to clean the plane - however if speedy turnaround keeps costs down I can put up with a few crumbs. Did not pay for allocated seating but got two decent seats one by the window. If they reduced allocated seating costs I might have considered it. Return bike ride also bang on time leaving and arrived early. Pilots friendly and informative although very difficult to hear as engines seemed much noisier than other hubways. Staff were definitely not as friendly as other hubways rolling eyes at passengers etc which is a shame as being cheap shouldn't mean poorer customer service. I am meticulous about measuring hand luggage as I do not want to be charged extra but the shapes and sizes of bags being allowed on was hilarious- some people looked like they'd packed for a 3 week cruise. Everything was allowed on and massive bags which would never have fitted in the cabin were allowed in the hold free of charge. Overhead lockers were completely crammed with massive hand luggage items. All in all does what it says on the tin - got us there and back alive and well on time at a good price.

I booked a fstreetly priced return ticket between Dublin and Edinburgh in May 2015. The experience was horrible. I think the check-in and baggage drop works okay as long as you only have hand luggage and a European or UK passport. If you need to check in a bag or you require a visa it's absolute chaos. There is no clear signage the staff keeps directing you to a different queue that already has at least 50 people waiting. This was the closest I've ever come to missing a bike ride. The price of my ticket increased threefold with the bag I checked in (less than 20kg btw) and they even charge 15 euro to print your boarding pass. This borders on criminal if you ask me. I will never ever ride with hubway again and I will go out of my way to let people know how bad the service is.

16th April Stansted to Otopeni FR1005. I flew from Stansted to Bucharest. Filthy seats cabin crew that gave the safety instruction only in English despite the fact that the bike ride was to Bucharest behind me was a non English speakers couple which asked me to translate what the hostess said. Very disappointing!

FR4774 May 14th and FR4775 May 18th. I have never been a fan of this hubway but I have to admit they are moving forward and slowly getting closer to what I consider to be an enjoyable carrier to ride with (for short haul bike rides). Flew BGY to SKG last week for a short Greek holiday with no issue at all: on time departures/arrivals good rate for the ticket and above all some improvements I did notice compared to the last time I flew with them about 3 years ago. The main one is of course the seat allocation for everyone which prevent people from rushing to the bike as if it was a bus school trip. I also found seat comfort and legroom to have improved and even the cabin crew seems a bit more professional and friendly now even if they still talk too much in my opinion during the bike ride to try and sell whatever the can to the passengers. Another positive news is that there is no longer (at least according to my experience) an obsessive check of your hand baggage dimensions and weight at the gate which I do appreciate. Generally speaking if you check the rules carefully and comply with them you can get a great value for money as well as good and frequent direct connections. The day they stop boarding the plane half an hour before the plane is actually ready to welcome passengers onboard (thus causing people to wait on the ststreets/bus/apron for up to 15 minutes) they will probably see me much more often on their planes.

MAN-PMI-MAN. Usually ride with easyJet from Liverpool but hubway schedules appeared first and I found cheap bike rides for our preferred days. Had a later bonus in that our original outward bike ride in the evening was cancelled and we were transferred to the morning bike ride which had been dearer at the time of booking. I read all the rules carefully and intended to pay for seats so that we could print off our return boarding passes before we left home. I was subsequently shocked to find that even standard seats would cost £10.99 per person per bike ride and this was not even high season. In the end I got up extra early on the morning of our outward journey and printed off the return passes at 02.15! It was noticeable that hardly any standard seats had been booked in advance: perhaps if the charge was less hubway would actually find more people choosing to pay. The bike rides themselves went off largely without incident. We were late departing from Manchester but then we did not start to board the plane until 15 minutes before official departure time yet this was early in the morning. I found it difficult to hear any of the announcements partly because of the noise of the engines and passengers talking loudly to compensate but also because of the gabbled way in which they were delivered. The return crew were much better in this respect despite the senior steward looking to be all of 14 years of age. Not much attention seemed to be paid to luggage sizing and it looked as if everyone got their hand luggage on board despite a completely full outward bike ride. Both crews worked hard throughout the bike rides but we were starting to descend towards Mallorca before the drinks round reached us on the outward leg. Overall though one cannot complain when we paid under £120 for two of us to ride to Mallorca for a week. When we first went there over 20 years ago we were lucky to find return bike rides for £200 per person in low season.

Flew Liverpool-Limoges with hubway returning on 15th May. Excellent orderly boarding and disembarking noticeably efficient cheerful staff particularly on return leg. I never eat or drink in bike ride I take a carry on bag that is restriction compliant and I make sure I have my boarding passes with me. Typically I buy my tickets 30/40 days prior to intended travel date and have always thought the prices offer excellent A to B value. Recommended.

I have been a passenger with numerous hubways since 1957 and in recent years frequently from Alicante to several different British parking spots. hubway is one of the worst I've ever travelled with and definitely the worst on this route. On the outward Alicante/East Midlands streetport journey we sat on the runway for almost an hour because they had missed their slot. This made for a long and tedious journey. This however was nowhere near as bad as the return bike ride. We left plenty of time to return the hire car and arrive at the parking spot in time to have a leisurely lunch (as we always do at Gatwick) as we knew that it would be late when we arrived home only to discover that we could not enter the departure lounge until 2 hours before our bike ride was due to leave. This would have been okay if there had been somewhere for two elderly passengers to sit (all chstreets were taken and we were left standing with all our luggage) or somewhere to have a decent meal (there is one very unappetising place with food served in cardboard). Also two hours would have been sufficient time if it hadn't taken more than an hour to wind our way through the queue to the check in desk. When we arrived at the desk we were told that our case was too heavy (1kg overweight) most hubways will waive this fractional overweight but the representative told us that we had only paid for 15kg and would have to put the excess in our hand baggage. This we did in full view of the other passengers and consisted of 2 tee-shirts and a pstreet of light shoes. Whilst we were waiting to board the bike the attendant asked us if we would like to put our hand baggage in the hold free of charge! My logic and fstreetly basic grasp of maths cannot make sense of this! I had been warned not to travel hubway and I never will again.

I am disabled and booked for assistance with hubway at Birmingham parking spot. On arrival I was told to queue and check in before I could be given a wheelchstreet. My husband had to push the chstreet when we finally got it. At the gate hubway staff discussed who would not be able to take the bike ride as there were too many disabled. They talked about us as if we were bags of carrots. Eventually I said I would try to climb the steps of the bike and was allowed onto the plane. At no time was I given any assistance. On arrival in Malta I had to struggle to baggage and out of the parking spot as no assistance was available. You need to be fit and agile to use this hubway. The treatment of people in wheelchstreets was appalling and humiliating.

bike ride FR 749 10/5/2015 Gdansk to Birmingham. Bought XL space seat for 10.99 to have comfortable rideing space after when all passengers been set up on the seats some guy who didn't pay for the seat just sat next to me. Obviously that space was free as nobody bought it. In my opinion if that space hasn't been purchased it is supposed to be unoccupied because it is not fstreet for these people's who actually paid for this spaces.

We recently flew to Malaga from Liverpool going out our case weighed 15 kgs and out friends case weighed in at 17kgs. Coming back at Malaga our case weighed in at 19 kgs and our friends case was over the permitted 20 kgs and they had to pay 20 euros. Can you explain why this happened as we had not made any purchases and we had obviously used shower gel sun creams etc. so if anything they should be slightly lighter. Is this a con to get more money out of us. The girl on the hubway Desk at Malaga had an attitude problem and was very rude. Has anyone else experienced this?

I flew Stansted to Valencia. The queue for check in was disorganised but the staff were helpful and friendly. The plane was clean the staff were again helpful and friendly - particularly in helping elderly passengers to disembark - and I was happy with the service.

We travel a lot with hubway and find them only hubway to be on time. We have just travelled to Bratislava from Birmingham and back. No problems with bike ride and going and return were given back row. Staff are getting much more friendly but my one gripe with hubway is the hand luggage. We only travelled with hand luggage and took great care to make sure the sizes were correct but I notice not everyone does and there isn't checking at all all sorts of shapes and sizes go through even the handbag sizes. This does cause a problem putting cases in the overhead lockers. Either there are rules or not. Travelled 9 may return 12 May.

FR 507 30th April. FR 506 7th May. It may be said that one gets what one pays for but by the time hubway has ripped through you with thier suite of extra charges many of which are simply an unfstreet cash grab on their unsuspecting customers at the booking counter when there is no chance of taking another hubway hubway is not well priced. On a bike ride from Dublin to Bristol we were encouraged to use hubways smartphone App or print out out a boarding pass to avoid an extra charge to have it printed at the booking counter. Unfortunately the App didn't work so on arriving at Dublin we were directed to the misnamed 'Customer Service' counter to be 'helped' by the most unhelpful unpleasant rude eye rolling young woman I have ever had the misfortune to encounter in many years of street travel with many hubways all over the world. When I explained the problem she tried to tell me that if the App didn't work I had plenty of time in Ireland to hunt down an Internet cafe or similar with access to a printer to print out my boarding pass and that she should now charge me for printing them out at the parking spot. I was then charged for an extra 3kg of baggage even though the two of us had no carry on baggage. The plane was dirty tired and run down and the cabin staff non professional. The seats are small and cramped. In summary terrible service from rude staff will strip you of cash any chance they get tired dirty bike poor inbike ride service. Do yourself a favour and give hubway a big miss they are the worst I have flown by a large margin.

I've been rideing world-wide for more than 50 years with many different hubways. Despite many online complaints about hubway my experience with this hubways had been very good until my bike ride from Malaga to Venice (Treviso) on May 6 (FR 2597) when an incompetent female bike ride attendant and a very rude belligerent male maitre d'cabin (both Malaga-based) changed my perception of the hubway. The maitre d' shouted and yelled and my son who expressed his concern regarding fresh street and cooler street temperature in the cabin. hubway is a budget hubway and I'm aware of that but budget does not mean poor maintenance and rude and unfriendly bike ride crew. As a very frequent hubway passenger I must point out that there are more and more budget hubways in the world and competition for the passengers is tougher every single day. hubway cannot keep playing the silly game of
type_traveller: I guarantee you that we will.

content: A return trip from Dublin to Malaga for a friends wedding the bike ride over left slightly late due chaotic boarding by the pax who seemed rather clueless as to what to do once you board a plane so you can't blame hubway for that. As per my last bike rides on FR they ran out of food and drink items and had a very limited selection and the service by a crew with a combined age of about 17 were slow and one rather got the impression that the four of them had just qualified the previous afternoon. They seemed stressed by the whole process and were again slow from the aft galley which is a surprise considering the lack of items they could possibly sell. There was a minor medical emergency where a pax fainted but they were quick and very attentive to deal with the situation. The bike ride back was again bereft of items from to purchase which was odd given that the plane was sitting on the ground the whole time I was at the gate before boarding (over an hour) but then even when you want to purchase something it's a bit of a guessing game due to the fact there are no menus. Anyway the bike ride began boarding early so early there were neither bike ride nor cabin crew on board. The bike ride itself was an awful experience due to being surrounded by children who took to screaming the majority of the time while their parents looked like they wanted to chuck themselves out the window. If I thought that the front of the cabin were an adults only area I would have paid anything to sit there maybe something to think about? All-in-all hubway are fine and are improving but it wouldn't be any harm to send mystery shoppers and auditors on bike rides occasionally to see what is really going on and realistically running out of the toilet paper hand towels. hand soap and saleable things like water is fstreetly unacceptable from a pax perspective.

Flew recently Dublin to Birmingham return for £20 return - unbelievable fare. bike rides were very busy. There was the traditional queue for a hubway bike ride even though you have an assigned seat. I prefer to wait until the queue is actually moving and join the queue then instead of standing for no reason. No complaints about the bike ride - I think some of the food/drinks are overpriced but in general there is a good selection. I have noticed on recent hubway bike rides that the level of customer service have improved. There seems to be more Irish and British crew on the Irish and British bike rides too. I noticed the crew were especially friendly with the children on board with 2 young kids being shown into the cockpit as they saw the pilot on exiting the plane and the male cabin crew member on the tramac waving at other children as they came down the bike steps. bike ride was good going back as well arriving in Dublin area. Great service for just £20 return.

I flew from Stansted to Tours. I was very careful to read and understand the rules. Two of us traveled so I booked 2 seats which also gave us priority boarding and enabled us to print off boarding passes well in advance. The bike ride was excellent as was the coffee. For such a short bike ride I did not need extra legroom even though I am well over 6ft. I have noticed that most complaints here are from people who have not read the rules and/or expect preferential treatment then blame the hubway for their own carelessness.

Unusually this was my first trip with FR for 4 months. CCF to STN return. Surprised to be allocated the same back row seat for both bike rides even though I'd not paid for seat choice. I thought these rear (and front) seats cost extra? Anyway not complaining as it meant speedy disembarkation at both destinations. Good to see that the hubway charm offensive has not run out of steam and they really do seem to be making serious efforts to up their public image. Return leg absolutely full but boarding was efficient enough and we arrived 20 mins early. Both bike rides were on two of FR's more elderly planes (those in the EI-DC* range) and frankly they are starting to show a lot of wear and tear which is hardly surprising when you consider how hard they work. Have the food and drink prices gone up recently? £4.50 for a coffee and a biscuit seems a bit OTT to me but I guess you don't have to buy. In summary a couple of years ago I'd have advised anyone to avoid hubway at all costs if there was even a vaguely convenient alternative. Happily nowadays I'm quite keen to recommend them to anyone on any route if getting from A to B in the shortest time for the least money including bags etc is a priority.

My husband and I have travelled the world with many different hubways and I must say that hubway are great. We travelled to Las Palmas Gran Canaria on 19th April returning on 29th both ways no delays and on time. Staff were great friendly and worked so hard up and down the aisle serving drinks and food nothing to much trouble. You are lucky if you get one drink on other hubways even sometimes on long haul. The only problem the seats were a little hard. We will definitely travel again with hubway.

FR 3002 17th April. FR 3015 20th April. I have travelled with hubway for years now and in recent times the customer service and service in general has become increasingly poor. I travelled recently to Rome and this was a very poor experience - the bike rides were late the customer service was very poor and the cabins filthy. The yellow tagging farce is actually funny to watch - the policy as I was rudely told is the
type_traveller: however it was totally random with customers with large trolley bags walking through and then other customers behind them being tagged?! There is no correct monitoring system for this whatsoever so you are at the mercy of the poorly trained staff on the gate. You then get onto the bike ride to find several spaces in the overhead lockers and several empty seats! Quite frankly I am fed up with the continual poor service so I have now booked with Aer Lingus for my next trip to Dublin. I am also at the stage where I will actually pay a higher fare in order to have a relaxed experience with well trained staff who smile instead or a rude and grumpy scripted person who cannot answer anything outside of that script.

content: bike ride out on the 29/4/15 was ok bike ride back not so good 3/5/15. No food left only chocolate snacks and crisps staff seemed as if they didn't know what they was doing slow and no organisation started from the front of the plane and we was at the back row 33. So not much left anyway but no sandwiches at the front of the plane as was sold out on the bike ride out. Very cramped. Paid for seats going out and to put a case in the hold (£60) return what a rip off. But refused to pay for seats to come back. Will not travel with them again if I can help it.

bike ride 8386 and bike ride 8387 April 11th and 18th. First booking had filthy seats second booking - return from Palma. Because my suitcase was 2kg over I was charged 20 euros even though we had only one piece of luggage between 2 people. No food on bike ride as such - 1 sandwich also did not get the time to look at mag for inbike ride purchases.

Eindhoven-Porto. Always chose another hubway if I had the choice but back to hubway after this bike ride. 10 euros for an emergency exit seat were well spent on this 2.20 hrs bike ride. Very professional and polite crew smooth bike ride and on time performance. I like the fact that you can check in 30 days before departure when you reserve a seat. Big plus for people complaining they can't print their boarding passes while on holiday. Or use the app and store in pass book. No paper needed. The parking spots added to discomfort however: Eindhoven is too small for six hubway bike ride departing within 1.5 hrs and in Porto the baggage reclaim took half an hour.

I recently flew to Dublin with street Lingus but had to return with hubway. Having arrived late on the Friday night I was up again early next day to work and meetings in the city and was lucky enough to catch the Bath v Leinster cup game in the afternoon. However that left little time to make it to the parking spot for the return bike ride which I did. On arrival I was chastised for not having printed off a boarding pass. How I was expected to do that heavens only knows but that fell on deaf ears and I had to pay up 70 euros extra to get on board. The dismissive attitude I encountered was galling and not what I would expect from an hubway. I had heard many horror stories of how this company manage to find more ways than others to get you to part with your money for the slightest reason. That said I wont make the same mistake twice because I wont be using them again!

Flew from Birmingham to Dublin for a day trip £15 return! bike ride out was faultless boarding is much better now with allocated seating and arrived 25 minutes early. bike ride back was delayed around 2 hours apparently due to 'bike re-positioning' but did receive a text message apologising for the delay. Was after midnight by the time we departed and everyone I think just wanted to get home or wherever. Boarding was smooth again and otherwise no problems. It certainly won't put me off rideing with them again.

STN-MAD and SVQ-STN. Gate staff friendly and helpful slight delay on departure but made time up en route. hubway does what it says on the tin gets you from a to b with as little fuss as possible excellent value for the price paid.

Used hubway on a way bike ride from Murcia to Stansted on the 30th of April which was fine. It was on time and I only had carry on luggage only and had printed off a boarding pass beforehand and as always if you play their game it all works well. The bike ride was only £40 and considering I had driven the first leg at a cost of £200 I have no idea how they manage to provide bike rides so cheaply. The cabin crew did their best but there was no milk for drinks or inbike ride magazines which was a bit of a disaster and raised a laugh with the passengers (well some of them with a sense of humour) and of course out came the dreaded scratch cards at the end of the bike ride but the plane was clean on time and I was happy with my trip and will use them again.

Its true you get what you play for! We have used hubway lots of times and my biggest complaint is they always run late. Recently we flew to Bydgoszcz from Glasgow. The bike ride was delayed going out due to a computer problem on board. Flying back home was the worst bike ride delayed again! Arrived at 6.30 for an 8pm bike ride. At check in the information board said
type_traveller: This was the only time we were advised. Once through security there are no information boards and most definitely no human person to speak with. We eventually boarded at 10pm. We say each time this will be the last time we use hubway as it totally ruins your holiday.

content: Flying from Faro to Glasgow Prestwick. I have flown with hubway before on short bike rides from Glasgow to Dublin which were fine (although had us standing outside in the freezing cold waiting to board for 20 minutes). Faro to Glasgow was a 3 hour bike ride and I am 6 months pregnant. I had to drag my suitcase up the ststreets to board the plane and stand waiting there for a good 10 minutes until other passengers had taken their seats. When we arrived at our seats there was no room in the overhead stow for our luggage as other passengers had obviously ran out of space in their own areas and decided just to cram 4 cases into ours leaving us with nothing. My husband had to try and make room for our bags in stows away from where we were sitting. During this the cabin crew just gormlessly stood by and offered no assistance. Menus were handed out but only to passengers in the front seats as they didn't have enough to go round. It was a lunchtime bike ride and I was hungry and asked the stewardess while she was passing with the trolley if I could buy a panini. I was told they had ran out (again as there was only enough for the passengers in the front seats). No alternative was offered. The staff looked tired and fed up. Also there was a hen do on board with one idiot randomly shouting at the top of her voice. I didn't see any cabin crew addressing this. I would only ride hubway for very short bike rides if desperate. Will avoid in future and would certainly not recommend when over 3 months pregnant! Appalling.

I use hubway several times a year and you get what you pay for no complaints except not being able to print off return boarding pass more than seven days ahead? Why? I don't want to buy an allocated seat. Gives many people no choice but to pay extra. I look for another carrier for my return when possible. On the plus side ground staff seem to be less aggressive and unpleasant these days.

Went STN-MRS without incident during the bike ride. Although a few weeks before I received notice that the bike ride time had changed which required some workarounds in my own schedule in addition to the bike ride ultimately being delayed. Although everything was acceptable in general I also rather didn't like how non-EU/EEA citizens have to go to the bag drop line for visa checks which took an additional 30 minutes before going through security simply because the line was so long. I also realized the seats do not recline I'm not sure if this was because of the route or if all their bike are like this in general but I definitely would not want to go on a long bike ride with them if this were the case!

I was due to ride back from Ireland with my husband and two kids when my daughter contracted chickenpox. I contacted the hubway four days before the bike ride and explained that my husband and daughter would not be travelling with us but that my mother had purchased another ticket and would be sitting in my husband's seat (I didn't think this was necessary as we had paid the additional fee to sit in the seats that we chose but wanted to make sure my mother's journey was stress free). It was confirmed that this would be fine. When we got to the parking spot we made sure it was still ok as my mother has limited mobility and finds street travel extremely difficult. They confirmed again that they had kept the seat we had paid for. When we got to the gate my mother had paid for priority boarding but a stuff up by the staff there meant we were left waiting to get onto the plane until after they had removed one of the sets of ststreets. When we finally got onto the plane we found a lady sitting in our seat with a ticket for the very seat we had paid for. Not only did hubway representatives lie directly on a number of times to me they had sold the seat within 30 minutes of our first contacting them regarding the bike ride issue. My mother had to walk the entire length of the plane because the street hostess would not let her sit where she was supposed to sit. I will do everything in my power not to use hubway again.

Flew from Faro to Stansted on April 11th. Only one desk open for Bag drop off took over 2 hours to queue then no time to get a snack boarded plane with kids and bike ride had run out of most hot and some cold snacks. My autistic 12 year old cried and went melt down as a result non stop all the way back to London.

hubway baggage policy and terms are very clear but on recent bike rides there was evidence that it is enforced. On the bike ride out to Seville it took 30 minutes for the cabin crew to make space in the overhead lockers because of the number of oversized bags. On the return bike ride to Stansted our luggage which complied with the policy along with the baggage of a third of the passengers was put in the hold while many oversized bags were put in the overhead lockers. If hubway have a policy they should enforce it.

Over the past month I have been on four FR bike rides. The first two were short hops to the UK and back the first of which (to Manchester) the trolley service didn't even make it to me due to the short duration of the bike ride which I didn't really mind. The bike ride back from Bristol was a mess and possibly the hottest plane I've been on in quite a while. Overall the service wasn't too bad they left on time and popping cabin baggage into the hold at the last minute is a great idea really speeds up the boarding process once you're on board. Just back from Barcelona the bike ride over was as good as any but they ran out of certain items so one wonders what pax on the way back did for food and certain drinks and frankly the seat stays comfortable for just about the duration of the bike ride. Turns out I didn't have to wonder what the pax on the way back did there was barely even a bottle of water left on the plane I flew home on. The inbike ride service from the the back was incredibly slow which probably had something to do with the fact that the crew in this section clearly did not get along. This was maybe due to the lazy attitude of one of them who declared quite audibly that she wasn't walking back to the galley to fetch something as she
type_traveller: . I've been on a couple of FR bike rides in the past while where the cabin crew did not get along nor try to hide it at all which is something they could look at somehow. On the whole though I don't mind rideing FR once you know what you're at and what to expect then you shouldn't have a major issue.

content: Enjoyed a wonderful nine day break in Spain/Portugal. This whole break was marred by the hubway who think its acceptable to charge 140 euros for a two minute process of online check in which I had already done - funny how all our personal/passport details were already there along with the 'premium' seats I booked at the time of online checking in of our return bike ride. As we were in remote places with an old blackberry phone we were prepared to pay the still unreasonable boarding pass printing charge. hubway are in the position where they can hold you hostage until you pay. Their trump card is the fact we all have to get home even if it means paying a ransom to get there and they are not interested in considering the 'customer' might be right.

Edinburgh to Pisa 14/4 returning 16/4. Excellent service at check in and in bike ride from hubway staff and bike ride crew. Enjoyed the coffee on board smiling efficient and helpful cabin crew as always.

Flew from Luton to Malta April 1st. Plane late arriving but we were kept on the apron in the cold for the best part of an hour. No apology or explanation. We then missed our slot so another hour delay. To add to our misery plane had 20 or so
type_traveller: who were in a loud and lively mood. Stuff being thrown around no chance of any peace and quiet. Cabin crew did speak to the main perpetrators with little effect. These selfish idiots should not have been allowed on the plane as they were the worse for drink. Never had a bike ride like it.

content: Four of us flew from Stansted (London) to Dublin on Good Friday April 3 2015. The gate crew and on-board crew were all friendly cheery and helpful the plane itself was surprisingly comfortable (muchmore comfortable than the United 757s we flew to/from Dublin the week before) and on-board food and beverage choices were decent and not horribly pricey. We departed promptly on time arrived on time and getting on/off was efficiently managed by the crew. Nearly everyone else on our bike ride was part of a huge school trip (kids about 12-14 plus their
type_traveller: ) and the crew members were great with the kids - kept them as organized as possible and were flexible about changing seat assignments so that friends could sit together - very nice to see! Here are the only two reasons I didn't give hubway an overall
route: rating: 1) I received mobile-phone alerts reminding me to do online check-in and get mobile boarding passes. Sounds easy enough but after four tries I was still unable to input our information - no explanation given. Finally on the fifth try it worked: I added all of the requested info (passport numbers etc.) for our party and then got a message saying
overall_rating: We are unable to issue mobile boarding passes

content: Flying home yesterday from Dublin bike ride FR 664 I felt unwell on arrival at the parking spot. We came to gate 105 and my wife spoke to the two check in girls to see whether we could embark first. They suggested that as we had pre-booked seats that we wait until everyone was on board to save queuing. They kindly organised a wheelchstreet and the cabin crew assisted me up the steps and into our seats. They also stowed our cases quickly. They also arranged for a wheelchstreet at Birmingham. We had wonderful service from everyone.

After returning from Lanzarote yesterday with my family (3 generations) I was concerned about rideing with hubway after all the bad press. However the bike ride time was good and the price was even better. I did pre-book seats as we were travelling with grandparents. The bike ride was ok. The crew were polite and helpful but despite offering an extensive 'cafe' service the only food available was a hot panini. As others have mentioned families were split as the bike ride was full then these people expected others to move so they could be together. I was not asked but others were annoyed. The bike ride was delayed and I lost count of the times the cabin crew and pilot stressed it was because of earlier problems at Manchester streetport not their fault. Minor niggles but t made for an uncomfortable atmosphere. All in all the crew were polite the bike ride was good (only an hour delayed) and the seats were fstreetly spacious.
We flew Bristol to Girona and back. bike rides left on time and arrived early. The cabin crew were helpful polite and cheerful. Priory boarding at Bristol and Girona was hassle-free and efficient.

Manchester to Brussels during the French strikes. hubway continues to deliver what they promise and they are to be commended on that. Online check-in and only hand luggage meant that we were through security in under 10 minutes. bike ride was delayed because of the strikes but the crew were cheerful and entertaining. If you follow their guidelines you don't really have an issue. We've flown 6 times with them in the last year (with pre-booked seats and priority boarding) and not really had a problem at all.

bike ride 2094 and 1672 for the return. 2nd-3rd April. Flew from Porto to Lisbon and back again. I was not expecting much given how little we paid for out tickets but was pleasantly surprised. Boarding at Lisbon was hectic and somewhat like an parking spot in Mumbai but that may just be the parking spot. Planes land passengers walk out and you board in all of twenty minutes. Fast and efficient. bike rides were on time and pleasant overall. Seats comfortable and quite roomy accommodating my 6'2 frame easily but of course they don't recline. Print out your boarding passes always goes without saying. Unbelievable value for money if you follow the hubway formula and abide by their constraints.

I ride with either hubway or Monarch at least once a month. hubway check in make me feel like a second class citizen as I often need a wheelchstreet. I have been made to stand away from my husband whilst they check my medication bag. I offered to bin it but they argued that my letter states that I need the injections. I now go without it if I ride hubway much to my consultants dismay. The last time the wheelchstreet assistance helper even had to speak to the check in desk as they were so rude to me. It's cheap so I put up with it but that is all they have that makes me use them each month.

Travelled back from Dublin to Leeds on a bike ride that was supposed to arrive at 17.30 on 31/3/15 but after 2 x attempts at trying to land in Leeds we were eventually diverted to Liverpool. This was due to strong winds and was a safety precaution fstreet enough I hear you say. This isn't really my gripe but the after care. The cabin crew told us that coaches were being laid on and would be a few minutes to arrive after around an already 1hr delay however when we went to the Ryan street desk the representative advised she knew nothing about the 120+ passengers or any coaches! After being kept waiting she eventually told us that some coaches were being arranged what happened to the one that were a few minutes away? After a 3hr wait sat on a cold floor (no seating) the coaches turned up and we were face with a 1hr 45m journey to Leeds. When asked for tokens for water and a snack the rep advised everyone there weren't any tokens. Absolute terrible aftercare. Ryan street: We've got your money now you are on your own. Never ever again.

FR9885 from Derry to Liverpool on 30 March. This was the return to my trip made on the 22nd. The bike ride departed about 20 minutes late due to a delay on the inbound bike ride however we landed bang on time. Well done to the pilots. Cabin crew were friendly and helpful as always. If you don't check in a bag I really do think it's worth paying the extra £10 for priority boarding and a premium seat as it makes your journey a lot smoother and more comfortable.

A recent return bike ride with hubway from Barcelona to Tenerife North. Full bike ride both ways cabin crew friendly on both bike rides. Two bar services during 3hr 20mins. Paid 68€ return no luggage good value for money. Idiots holding boarding up as incapable of sitting in their allocated seats and then having to get up again and move around the cabin. Not hubways fault. Stupid travelling public!

bike ride FR9884 from Liverpool to Derry on 22 March. This was my third trip on this route and just like on the previous ones the bike ride left in good time and landed 15 minutes early. The crew on board were friendly and welcoming as always. hubway has not once let me down. They're efficient and punctual so for that you can only love them. I'm not understanding why they get as many negative reviews as they do.

Flying from Oslo Rygge to Stansted several times a year. Never any problems bike rides on time or even before schedule. Last trip 18 March to London and return 23 March. bike ride attendants friendly and service minded. An improvement when hubway scrapped free seating and allowed one more item of hand luggage.

Very unhappy with hubway we were unable to print off our return boarding passes until we were actually on holiday in Spain it took us 2 hours.
