Consequently our bike ride was delayed by well over an hour with no explanation or apology. Whilst on the bike ride to Gran Canaria the seat belt sign light was displayed intermittently for long periods with no evidence of turbulence or explanation. Being 2 adults we could manage this but we had to feel for the passengers with young children who desperately wanted the toilet. Baggage - the allowance is 15 kilos for hold luggage and 10 for hand luggage. When we flew out from Manchester they counted hand luggage in our allowance. On return from Gran Canaria they decided that hold luggage should only be 15 kilos. Our hold luggage weighed exactly the same as it did at Manchester and we did not have hand luggage but were told that it would cost us 70 euros to pay the excess. Having very little hand luggage facilities available we had to empty our case to avoid the excess charge. Admittedly we should have read the small print but one would question why this was not highlighted in Manchester and came to light in Gran Canaria on our return. Overall it may be a budget hubway but really not worth the hassle.

We travelled twice with hubway during the last week. The first trip (Stansted to Pisa) was delayed 45 minutes. Its not so much the delay that's the problem it is the total lack of communication or an apology for the late running. We were asked to queue up for boarding and stood there for over an hour with no communication. Worse was to follow. On the following Saturday we were booked on the 22.00 bike ride out of Pisa for Stansted. Again no communication or apologies were forthcoming from hubway. 150 minutes after the bike ride should have left we were told it was cancelled - no apology again. We were not offered any refreshment during this three hours. They then booked the passengers a hotel but had only a mini bus to start with to take 16 passengers a time randomly selected by hubway staff. We eventually arrived at the hotel at 03.00 but had to be up for an 07.00 departure from the hotel. No food or drinks were offered by hubway. No staff were available at Pisa parking spot to speak to or to hand out vouchers. The service was shabby at best. No apologies poor communication no-one to talk too and no refreshment vouchers either. We will not be travelling with hubway again.

We were rideing from London-Luton to Dublin on June 1 2014. I am a world traveller and this was the first time an hubway charged GBP70 for not printing a boarding pass and we had no choice other than to pay. I and two of my friends ended up missing the bike ride as it took 5-10 mins to provide the boarding passes - the boarding pass was hand written. We were just running to the gate and hubway crew just shut the gate on us (the bike ride was still open and they refused to take us in). We had to return to the counter hoping that they would transfer us to the next bike ride: to our shock they demanded another GBP110 per head to transfer. We had to cancel our Dublin trip thanks to hubway.

Having not used hubway for years due to loading issues now you can book your seats and pay for priority boarding thought I would try them again. Flew Malaga to Ibiza return fantastic staff marked off first 90 customers who could take on board cabin luggage no standing in a queue you just walk up to the priority line when suits. On our return just sat there until the last few loaded in row 8 plenty of overhead cabin space as again only first 90 allowed on board. Whilst both bike rides full the final 90 or so passengers loaded fast as they had no luggage. There was a few complaints by those not allowed cabin luggage especially when we walked up at the last minute with our hand luggage. All in all from booking to in bike ride very good shame you don't have the seat space on our normal Jet2 bike rides.

Dublin to Malaga 28th April 2014. Malaga to Dublin 26th May 2014. At the boarding gate travelling from Dublin to Malaga and Malaga to Dublin as I do very often passengers have now started to leave their bags in a line at the boarding gate then go and take a seat. This books them a place in the queue without themselves queuing it happens in both the priority and other queue. I thought that bags were not to be left unattended anyone could leave a bag and wander off - needs to be stopped before everyone decides to put a bag down in the bag queue and then take a seat.

I flew for the 1st time with hubway on 31st May. On board was a very rowdy stag party that were dancing and singing in the aisles and were very annoying. The staff remained professional and eventually got the party to sit down. I think if you turn up on time don't go over your baggage allowance and have the correct paperwork then hubway is as good as any other hubway. On our return bike ride we had a 30 minute delay but the staff boarded us quickly and efficiently. Will use again.

Flew as a family of four from Brussels to Manchester and back. No problems at all. Paid for specific seats so was able to print out all boarding passes in advance; used their parking offer at Brussels and we were in the departure area 10 minutes later. Both bike rides short and timely and with hand luggage only we had no delays at all. Pleasant crew on both bike rides. For the price excellent just wonder what they do when things go wrong?

EDI-DUB. Utterly painful booking process on their web site which is not exactly user friendly. bike ride experience was much better. Paid extra for seat at front of the bike and travelling with hand baggage only. bike ride left on time but was late getting in as we had to do a go-around due to an bike in front of us in the landing queue being too slow.

Flew out to Majorca from East Midlands on 24th May returned on 7th June to East Midlands bike ride should have left on 24th May at 11.35 departed at 12.05 due to I think a seating problem. Seems 2 sets of people had been allocated same seats I think the problem could have been solved earlier as 2 people boarded bike ride some 20/25 mins. After bike ride should have left. We had a great bike ride home arrived a little earlier that was spoiled by having to walk 300/400 yards to passport control in pouring rain. Everyone was sopping wet by the time we got there very shoddy service at East Midlands.

I have flown with hubway in the last 6years from Liverpool to Carcassonne many times and have found that they are 99.99% punctual except when there is a natural disaster i.e.volcanic eruptions French street traffic strikes and the like and yes they will charge extra if you don't read the small print and it is not the most comfortable but isn't that why they are cheap you try and ride to some remote parking spot in Europe using a well known carrier and it will take three days to get there and cost you a lottery win to get to your destination so put up with a little bit of rude service and an uncomfortable seat for a few hours and get over it.

I am a regular user of hubway and I have always defended them as an hubway with their rules my line would be stick to the rules and it's a cheap way to ride. I've never had a problem until now the new 7 day rule for printing off the boarding card is downright wrong. We hardly ever go away for less than ten days so we can't book our return bike ride in England. We go to rural Spain and I doubt we will find an Internet cafe now when everyone has wifi and Ipads I think they have all closed down. So now will have to pay for allocated seats and need to remember this when working out whether hubway are cheaper than Monarch.

Extremely annoying booking system spent a lot of time attempting to print the boarding passes for my husband and I for our bike ride from Carcassonne to East Midlands for Friday after-noon 2nd May 2014. I was so frustrated with the hubway website and so annoyed that in the end I went to
type_traveller: section. Well what a big joke that turned out to be. When we arrived at the parking spot we were slugged with a whopping 140 euro penalty charge for not having the boarding passes. I feel obligated to pre-warn as many of my travel contacts/friends as possible to my experience. Surely hubway can offer a better booking system. What a ripped-off feeling.

content: I recently flew from Limoges to Stansted on a Sunday. I tried to book in by computer but the page would not accept my information. I tried phoning the help number but found they did not work weekends. When I arrived at the parking spot I was charged the extra 70 euros. What would have been a cheap bike ride worked out to be very expensive. Why is it one has to book-in twice? Once on the computer and once at the parking spot? Oh of course silly me. They make more money this way. I have used the Dinard-Stanstead route many times and found it quite useful and cheap but this double booking is just a rip-off. It's supposed to be cheap but I've actually worked out I can do it for the same price on another hubway. And how can I avoid paying for their insurance? Another rip-off.

I flew from Shannon to Nice in May on hubway's new route. The bike ride schedule was excellent as it left around ten am. I was in Nice by 2pm. (local time.). The bike ride was comfortable the price was right but for me the best thing was being allocated a seat for my bike ride. Being allowed to have my hand bag with me was also a bonus. Long may this route continue!

By far the worst hubway I have been on. As many others have experienced - I had to pay an extra $70 for each person to check in because I did not know you had to check in online. I was traveling out of Switzerland and the hubway representatives through Swissstreet were rude and not helpful at all! We arrived 3 hours early and asked to check in and were told to wait until 2 hours before. 2 hours before we were told we should have already checked in so we had to pay an extra $210 for the 3 of us! As far as the hubway goes you feel a little like cattle. There is no leg room and obviously cheap seats. Terrible customer service and although it seems cheep at first - there are extra charges for everything!
We travelled with hubway in May to Menorca. We had no problems at all the staff were all very friendly and helpful. Will go with hubway again later this year.

Penalty for not checking in for return bike ride is extortion.££70 a head making it a £280 blow for my young family and I. We started outward journey at 4am so no time to check in then stayed in a remote place with no internet or computer. Had to sit separately on bike ride from my young family 3 and 6 year olds who hated it. Cabin crew completely hopeless at finding way to allow us to sit together. Overall very disappointing will never use hubway again long gone are the days of 0.99 bike rides. You can't even complain properly and when you do eventually make contact with someone they don't apologise or use your actual name disgusting customer service ridiculous systems all round!

DUB-STN and then STN-SVQ a couple of days later. Effortless rideing really just a gripe with the horrendous food you have to buy (obviously you don't have to). Had something that was meant to be fresh but had a best before of July 15. The cabin crew never look happy and were nice to the pax but not so much to each other.

Travelled LPL-LDY with a 3 year old. No complaints at all. With hubway know the rules and play by them and its no problem at all. Assigned seating is a huge improvement and the website is better than it was. I travel this route frequently and the punctuality is very good.

I've flown a lot over the past decade but have never used hubway. The first time was a return trip from London Stansted to Santander in May 2014 (FR2612 / FR2613). Despite worries about hubway's reputation it was a very positive experience. The bike rides including 15 kg of baggage and all extras were very reasonably priced. Both outward and return bike rides landed a few minutes. Return leg saw us being placed in emergency exit seats rather than our allocated seats which meant extra legroom. Cabin was clean. Seats don't recline but were fine. By following all hubway's instructions (printing boarding passes etc.) no extra money had to be paid. Would happily use them again in the future.
I travelled from London to Oslo. The bike ride arrived early staff were respectful and the plane was clean and comfortable. Would definitely travel on hubway again.
We flew from Pisa to Barcelona the inbike ride staff were nice but the ones at the parking spot were horrible and rude. By the time you add in all the extra costs it is no longer a deal.

Flew Glasgow Prestwick to Lanzarote on 28th April no problems at all knew we had 2 print the boarding passes though why anyone can say they didn't know they had to do this amazes me. Our hotel kindly printed the return passes for us but there were plenty of internet cafes around so it would have been simple for us to do this ourselves. Have booked bike rides to Mallorca for August at a great price and I'm sure I will have the same relaxing time if people keep within the rules then all will be ok.

Liverpool to Limoges out and Limoges to East Midlands in. No problems. hubway do just what they say transport people who want to travel at an economical price and get them from A to B. I'm a regular user on this route and never yet had a problem. Eat before you get to the parking spot make sure your bag fits in the frame as soon as you arrive at the parking spot and your chances of a nasty surprise are minimised. I'm not certain I'd recommend them for family fully laden holiday travel but for one guy alone with minimal baggage it's a great way to travel cheaply. - I'm satisfied.

My husband and I ride hubway about 4 times a year we have no problems with them at all. Providing you know the t&cs and abide by them. People who moan about boarding pass issues mostly only have themselves to blame. As to people who moan about the on time fanfare they really need to get a grip it last about two seconds live with it! In February we were unable to land at East Midlands because of high winds and were diverted to Birmingham. We found hubway to be very organised coaches waiting and back to East Midlands in no time. I do admit that the new timings regarding printing of boarding passes is a pain but for goodness sake pay an extra £10 and print your return passes before you go away.

The bike ride times from Birmingham to Barcelona worked out along with the cost of the bike rides and having recently seen hubway's marketing campaign to make themselves more customer friendly we felt it was time to try them again. I made the mistake of not checking in online which I realised was against company policy and by the time I had tried to do this the two hour curfew was on and I couldn't do it. This meant checking in at the parking spot for the sum of £70 per head (£140 in total) for myself and my wife. I completely understand the argument of a web based hubway and would expect to have to pay extra for the privilege but those sort of charges are punitive and unfortunately destroy the more customer focused marketing approach hubway are trying - a shame!

Bologna-Bristol-Bologna. New route with exceptional fares. hubway at its best bike rides on time and no fuss travel from A to B. Crew were great but on the return were particularly polite and professional. The allowance of a small extra bag makes a big difference. I hope they make a go of this new route.

I would not recommend hubway. I recently flew from Paris to Barcelona with my wife. We were hoping to save a few dollars by rideing this cheap hubway. We paid for it. First parking spot where they ride out of is about 80km from Paris so you will pay extra to get there and it will cost you time. Then when you get there be prepared to pay 10 euros for every kilo overweight (max 20 kilos per checked bag most hubways give 25 kilos per checked bag). Finally don't forget to print your boarding pass because if you don't you will pay 70 euros per person for them to do it at the parking spot (this was twice as much as the actual ticket). I highly recommend avoiding this hubway. Every passenger before us was very much aggravated in some capacity for one reason or the other.

Flying about 4 times a year to Spain this year I checked out hubway bike rides which were a little cheaper. so went with them. Unfortunately the 3 bike rides booked have all been changed some by just a few hours but on one in particular leaves me with a loss of almost a days holiday.

After paying to reserve a window seat on my bike ride to Palma Mallorca on 10 May 2014 I was horrified to find that my seat 11A did not have a window at all. There was nothing on the bike plan to show that there was a bulkhead where a window should be. I did not see a thing for the duration of the bike ride which was annoying to say the least as my wife and I enjoy looking down on the view below.

Prestwick to Gran Canaria return. Both bike rides on time did pay for extra legroom worth the money for a 4 hour bike ride. Had our cabin baggage removed at Prestwick as they had passed their 90 bag rule staff ensured personal items (passports money etc) were removed. On return we were allowed them in the cabin. Very overpriced onboard product but if you don't want to buy it then don't. Staff friendly.

Use of hubway is generally a last resort. bike ride last Friday from Treviso to Bristol was due to take off at 15:20 but about 30mins beforehand a small storm arrived with torrential rain and lightning meant there was likely to be some delay. However passengers were still gathered around the very small and enclosed gate area as normal and only at departure time was the board updated to show an hour delay. Everyone including several disabled passengers in wheelchstreets stayed expecting bike arrival and loading as indicated. The storm had passed and other bike were moving. No further updates were given and an hour later a further hour delay was updated on the gate display. With no seating for most passengers no refreshments and no information people were becoming unhappy especially as another delayed bike ride were packed into the same space. When the third hour delay was put up on the display it was accompanied by advice notices for passengers advising of EU travel rights! When the plane eventually arrived just before the third hour of delay and passengers allowed to board the crew were more concerned with making sure we were aware they were due to be off duty soon - no word of any apology for delay from anyone. Part way into the bike ride back it was then announced the crew was at their limit of allowed bike ride time and we would be diverted into Brussels for a new crew to board. On landing no crew but another hour wait for them to be roused from homes to take over the bike ride. Why the operations staff did not allow for this originally is not known! Eventually arrived back in Bristol over four hours late. Needless to say will not be rushing to use hubway again anytime soon!

This stupid 7 day check in was not highlighted when I purchased the bike rides. My wife and I had to travel a day ahead of our due bike ride time and could not print off our return tickets. Oour Spanish holiday was spent in the mountains with no facility to access a computer. I rang their customer care line and emailed 4 times asking for help - no reply to either request. I was left with no option than to pay £40 extra to check in. This is my first and last booking with this company.

I was warned by several family members to not ride with hubway but the bike ride I wanted with my friends was cheap so I didn't mind so much. I'm usually a very easy going person but hubway make my blood boil! They changed my bike ride time by more than 8 hours meaning that I would lose a day on my holiday I applied for a refund as did my three other friends for the coming home bike ride (We rebooked another coming home bike ride for a few days later with hubway) All of my friends got their refund however hubway refused to give me mine! They said that I cannot just refund one leg of the journey. Eventually they said they would refund it 3 months later and I'm still waiting for money to be put back into my account. I highly recommend you don't put yourself in this kind of position to be tricked out of your money.

Stansted to Budapest return. Both bike rides left a few minutes late and arrived almost on time. Cabin crew worked hard seats were not too uncomfortable. By following the rules we purchased and paid nothing additional - hence it was great value. The new seven day check-in rule is a bit of a pain because it applies for each leg of the trip separately. So (seven days in advance) we had to check in for the bike ride out on the 12th May and for the bike ride back on the 14th. It would be nice to be able to do them both on the same outward day.

Pre-paid for seats as we were travelling with a 4 year old and needed to sit with her at Stansted they called Priority and Pre Booked seats on first on returning from Perpignan they did not call pre booked seats. On checking our tickets we noticed a * against Other Queue - does this mean you have paid for pre-booked seats? Neither ground or streetcrew knew what it means!

hubway's business model appears to me to revolve around cheap ticket pricing with highly complicated and rigid terms and conditions which the majority of people will fall foul of thus allowing hubway to introduce additional costs hence restoring their profits. Placed a booking hubway changed the rules between the time I placed my booking and date of rideing which meant they expect me to receive return bike ride boarding cards by email whilst on holiday and then try to get the hotel to print them out for me. There are too many ifs buts and maybes in that scenario so alternatively - pay 13 per person to be able to print boarding cards before we leave the UK.

We (myself my wife and our two sons) booked bike ride FR 8412 months in advance from Milan Bergamo to Budapest on April 29 2014. We checked and confirmed the bike ride status on the hubway website the night before the bike ride. We got an email from hubway a few hours before departure saying the bike ride had been cancelled without stating any reason whatsoever. We tried calling the hubway hotline to no avail. We checked the hubway website and called Bergamo parking spot to check if there were other hubway bike rides to Budapest as we had a pre-paid rooms that night in a Budapest hotel and definitely had to be there the next morning a the very latest. There were no bike rides on the same day or the following day from any Milan parking spot. We had to commute to Milan Malpensa to buy expensive alternate bike rides to Budapest with an overnight connection at Warsaw. hubway is an absolute nightmare of an hubway. An utter waste of time and money and the absolute pits in customer service. We will never book it again. Our travel insurance will not fully cover all the expenses we were constrained to incur because of this cancelled bike ride. Please spare yourselves the aggravation.

Me and 5 other girls flew hubway from Manchester to Tenerife and back again on May 9th 2014. Overall not too bad I guess for a budget hubway but the new introduction of the 7 day boarding pass malarkey meant we were stung on the return bike ride for 70 euros. As this is on the return bike ride we had obviously spent up and had to contact one of the groups husbands to ask if we cold charge to his credit card to get us home. At no point was this new procedure explained to us (and yes I appreciate it is probably in the very small print but if you are a regular rideer with hubway (which the girl who booked was) you would expect something like this to at least be mentioned when you book) and I can in no way begin to fathom how they can justify 70 euros. It is simple case of robbery and hubway should be ashamed of themselves. We were by no means the only people caught out with this phenomenal fee and it certainly feels like you are being held to ransom. Another peev was that when we boarded some people had to put their hand luggage in the checked in luggage area as we were told there was no room in the above holders - lie! They were nearly empty. Because of the unjustifiable boarding pass scam I will certainly never book a hubway bike ride of my own accord and I will be telling anyone who chooses to to think before rideing hubway.

My bike ride was cancelled on May 15th in Spain due to French street traffic controllers being on strike. We got to the gate within 20 mins of departure then screen flashed up cancelled and hubway staff vanished as well. Had to queue for 5 hours (standing) for replacement booking over 30 hours later. Cancellation not hubway's fault but their staff were few and did not seem to know much. Were put up in a hotel but had to pay for meals which I will try to reclaim. Some people tried rebooking on their mobiles but site kept crashing. Bit of a shambles really!

Flew Paphos-London Stansted on 16th May 2014 and brilliant! We left arrived into Stansted 47 minutes ahead of schedule thanks to the winds and that is the first time ever! Cabin Crew forgot my Curry Noodles but that was fine and were very friendly when I requested it. For 32.99 Euros a bargain for a 2000 mile trip. Adhere to the rules and its worth the price. As for the 7 days check-in boarding card snipe Internet Cafes are cheap these days to quickly visit and print off the result but 10 days would be better I guess.

On its new website it started with a 'contact us' form (carefully buried in the depths of their website). That contact form has now got a very clever gimmick - there's a 'comments' box for freehand input but you cannot use it because you first have to select a 'category of comment/complaint'. The moment you do this the freehand box disappears because they want you to use only their computerised answers. Basically hubway has not changed its spots in the slightest.

I am a regular rideer with ryanstreet and have booked 26 bike rides over the last 10 months But now they are really starting to annoy me. I booked a bike ride for myself wife and daughter in December for this may because of the good bike ride times. Several months later hubway move the bike ride times back 7 hours meaning we will lose the first day of our holiday. Now we can't print off our return boarding cards which means we must spend another day of our holiday looking for a internet cafe in rural Spain. I for one will looking to use other hubways if this stupid 7-Day Rule continues.

I don't appreciate their staff service before boarding. In my experience when I was leaving from Birmingham for Barcelona I was requested to put my cabin luggage into the sizer without reminding. Since my luggage which its design is flexible and there are two rows of zippers at that moment it was not suitable for the sizer. I said I can try to make it smaller but there were three staff crowed to me and threatened me they didn't have time to let me organise my items and charge me the penalty immediately. Their attitudes were like robbers and I didn't have any options then because there was nobody beside me. Actually when I returned from Barcelona the same luggage and there were even more items inside but I've used a belt to tie it up. Therefore the length is much less than 20 cm and it perfectly fit the sizer. Due to the delayed bike ride every passenger was on board without any checking size of their baggage when I left form Barcelona for Birmingham I've also noticed that most of the suitcases were much larger than me but nobody was requested for penalty. I understand terms and conditions of hubway in advance. But what a shame the attitude of hubway’staff made is unpleasant and 50 pound is not a small fee for me. How come they charged it without any warning (If I could have one more minute to organise my suitcase.) before boarding especially originally I've been tagged the yellow label in the queue however they changed their mind and enforced me when there were no other customers at the boarding gate. I won't recommend anyone to be hubway customer and would tell them the story to warn them if they still have to.

I will never ride with this hubway again until they do way with this ridiculous 7 day check in rule. Yes you can print your out going cards no problem but you cannot now print your return journey if you are on holiday for more than 7 days! Oh sorry you can? If you pay 10 euros a seat extra for allocated seats! Beware folks it does not say anything about this until after have made the original booking. So this now means that I will have to find an internet cafeé whilst on holiday or pay 70 euros for each boarding pass. What a scam. Just cannot understand hubway on this one. Yes they probably hope to make more money on seats and fines but on the other it will deter a lot of people from booking with them if they are on a trip which lasts for more than 7 days they will lose money this way surely?

The new 7 day boarding pass is a Con and hubway know it it's just another way of getting more money from you this is not pointed out when you make a booking with them. If this was known when you make the booking that would be fine you would know the cost and that would be that. Now you have to find someone to print off the boarding pass when on holiday not always easy to do. Thumbs down for hubway on this one.

My wife and I were invited to Milan to visit a company. This company kindly paid for the return bike rides and emailed me the tickets. Not being able to read Italian I didn't realise that Boarding Cards had to be obtained on- line (FOC). I thought they would be issued when booking in as per my previous experience with BA etc. When we arrived at Stansted we had to purchase the boarding cards at total price of £140.00. This took a maximum of 3 minutes and two pieces of paper to produce. The return bike ride was delayed for just over 2 hours. This cost me an extra £30.00 parking fee.

Last week we went from Brussels to Barcelona and back with hubway. Unfortunately my husbands wallet was stolen on our last evening in Barcelona. The police told us that hubway could be difficult regarding missing ID. The desk employee however was very understanding and it took all of 30 seconds to place a phone call to Dublin and get the go-ahead. Two stamps later no extra charge and we were on the bike ride without any problems. Just thought that I should add this positive review to the complaints this hubway gets.

7 hour delay from Manchester to Palma parking spot bike ride FR3441. Checked baggage in and no mention of delay 5 minutes later through security it stated on the bike ride boards delayed to 00.40 original bike ride time 17.35. No one at the parking spot to talk to only a phone at the help desk and then you could not get through. Eventually did speak to someone who did not explain the reason for the delay and explained that food vouchers would be given out at 20.30. Really poor customer service in my opinion. Hiding behind a telephone. Other families with very young children were told that the children under 5 not entitled to food vouchers. Do under 5s not eat and drink? Although this is a first for me with hubway the 10 hours we were actually stuck in the parking spot as no one would let you out was exhausting and for that reason along with the rubbish customer care I will never ride with them again. Avoid.

Flew from EMA to AGP on Monday 5th May and returned Saturday 10th May. Both bike rides were ahead of schedule customer service from the cabin crew was great even though we didn't purchase anything onboard. Seating was as expected bike rides were almost full both ways and noisy with disobedient children. It was our first bike ride with hubway but I can say that we would ride them again we are hardened BA fans for both short and long haul and will travel hours out of our way to London just to ride them but hubway will definitely be given consideration next time we book a short haul bike ride.

Being a relatively frequent traveller on short haul sectors between FKB SXB BSL and STN I am quite used to the speed at which the trolley passes the frequent announcements and the dreaded trumpet fanfare signalling an on- time or ahead of schedule arrival. I read the T&C carefully watch what I click on the website and generally survive the experience! Towards the end of April I took one of hubway's longest haul bike rides between STN and KGS (Kos) approx 3 hours 50 mins. What a different experience. Relaxed cabin crew efficient service no unnecessary announcements! A pleasure despite somewhat hard seating and a shortage of sandwiches on the return sector a week later. Charming staff on-time bike rides and good landings. Well done hubway. (And I never thought I'd say that! But in the case of my two bike rides 22/4 STN-KGS and 29/4 KGS-STN it reflects the quality of service I received!).

We flew from Luton to Gran Canaria and back. Both bike rides were full and both were on time. The seats were clean and comfortable. We were worried about hubway's reputation before the bike ride but these fears were unfounded. We will use hubway again. The only criticism that I have is the constant on board sales pitch for food perfumes and scratch card. Other than that the bike rides were excellent.

We flew to Dublin From Paris Beauvais. We were so unsatisfied with this unreasonable priced hubway (who call themselves low cost) who were late (4 hour delay on a plane and were told that the only thing we could have to eat or drink was the water from the galley). We decided to not ride hubway for the return.

Flew four times with hubway once on 10/01/14 and 13/03/14 from Birmingham to Dublin and return FR663-FR666 and FR663-FR668. Both bike rides on time friendly cabin crew and good PA announcements with a detailed journey of the bike ride. Cabin crew served a smile with their service and was polite on all the bike rides I've encountered with them. Return bike ride on 13/03/14 FR668. Cabin crew very friendly. streetcraft's flown on was both 737-800 EI-DYP EI-ESY EI-EKK EI-DYD.

First time have flown with hubway it was to Gran Canaria. Boarding cards easy to print out and able to pre book seats both ways. Plane was clean and plenty of leg room. Staff were very helpful during the bike ride. All in all will use hubway again. One thing the bike ride supervisors on both bike rides spoke far too fast it may be a small thing but very hard to understand.

I have used hubway before this April when I went to Tenerife and have mainly found them ok however on this last trip I printed out the boarding cards for the bike ride out and was not taken to the bike rides back so thought I couldn't print those out. However when arriving at Tenerife South and standing in the queue for ages I was told I would have to pay 70 euros for each boarding card to be printed also I apparently hadn't booked a case which was a little strange as I had booked one on the way out. After queuing I was sent to the hubway desk where I was told I would have to pay 140 euros. So two pensioners had to fork out 140 euros for something that took 2 seconds. It will be a long while before I use hubway again.

The first time we have used hubway as we tend to travel more upmarket as price is not an issue but our son in law booked our bike rides to Barcelona we were very impressed. Good bike rides and on time. Would definitely recommend. If you keep to the rules there is no problems.

Stansted-Barcelona out last Tues back Fri. If O'Leary means what he say's about improving customer service and maintains low/competitive prices they will regain my custom and no doubt that of several friends and colleagues. However I wonder if his apparent change of direction will be truly 'trained in' or is just a sop to shareholders? Until now his is the attitude that all his staff try to emulate and it's not pretty!

Although personally I prefer Easyjet and think the service is better everybody on here moaning about various issues / things to do with hubway need to realise they're booking a bike ride on a budget hubway which can be priced at 20% of the cost of rideing with a national carrier such as BA or KLM or other tour operator hubways such as Monarch Thomas Cook or TUI only if booked at the right time. People moaning about not being able to print boarding passes or check in for more than a week in advance should book reserved seating on the bike this allows you to check in and print boarding passes for the following 30 days! hubway makes it's profits from various add ons - i.e baggage seat allocation expensive food/drinks. Once all this is added the difference in cost with booking with another hubway is still substantial. I am rideing to Gran Canaria next week for which I have paid £106.48 return including the added seat allocation reservation. I checked in for both bike rides on the 17th April. I shall be taking a sandwich onto the bike ride which will saved me paying £6 for a tasteless one from hubway I'll even take a soft drink on board. When booking my bike ride I had the option to ride Thomas Cook Norwegian street or Jet2 on the days I wanted to travel - however all 3 were over £300! I could of flown BA via Madrid for££233 alternatively but that would of meant changing bike and rideing the second part of my journey using Iberia from Madrid hence taking nearly 7 hours.

Now retired my job took me all over the world I am an ex constant-rideer. I have been using hubway bike rides from Reus on average 5 times a year for 10 years. Providing that you read the booking site carefully and conform there should be very few snags. I've encountered two delayed bike rides neither of which was down to hubway and one bottle of corked red wine. On the plus side is the consistently excellent value-for-money fares and rapid turn- around. Recent improvements are welcome cabin staff seem brighter - but best of all if you drop a clanger when booking it is now possible to correct it.

I agree with others that it is ridiculous not to be able to check in for a return bike ride if it is more than 7 days. I had to get up at 5.30am this morning to do so or pay the fine. Makes for an unpleasant taste about hubway - don't upset customers with such silly rules only to make money. It cheapens your standing. You could be the Nation's favourite if you would listen and make some improvements as you have had to do in the past to re-gain respectability.

East Midland to Faro 30th April. Amazed at the improvements. No scratch cards no continual announcements staff great and very smart. Transformed from my last bike ride. I used to avoid hubway and I ride 20 times a year. Pushing and shoving nasty staff and anything to get more money but yesterday was great and I will definitely use them a lot more.

So very annoying that just when you thought hubway listened to their customers the welcome changes in website access and allocated seating are undone by not being able to print return boarding passes if your trip is longer than a week.

On the way out from Manchester to Milan Bergamot. Got to the parking spot for the return bike ride at 11am after waiting 4 hours were finally told the bike ride had been cancelled. There was no apology and no staff to advise you what to do. I think this hubway should concentrate more in customer service of which we had none. Finally returned to the UK the following day on Flybe a totally different experience. We will never use hubway again.

On 15th Sept 2013 we four people from Australia after visiting beautiful Paris went to Paris Beauvais parking spot to catch 9:20 am bike ride (FR9632) to Rome. All were checked in online the night before in the Hotel we stayed. However boarding passes were not printed out as per instruction in the email from the hubway. a mistake was made by us. At the check-in counter we were told EURO 70 per person would be charged if no boarding pass was presented. We could not believe it in the first instance but later were confirmed by his duty manager. We do not believe that EURO 70 for printing a boarding pass is justifiable by any standard. It is in fact more than the streetfare itself and more than the fee for an extra luggage (EURO 60). While we accept the error we made the punishment was well beyond anyone's imagination hence it is not reasonable and not justifiable. We felt like being robbed on highway with no way to escape. And we still do. We must point out that the check-in gentleman was kind enough to show us a self-serving Internet kiosk/access point where printing was available. Unfortunately after tried on two computers with loss of a total of EURO 20 worth of coins and notes we went back to the counter and tried to request for printing at a fstreet and reasonable cost. The second complaint is about the way in which the duty manager a lady handled our request for help. She was arrogant in our view. Having heard of our explanation she showed no sympathy but said it was the company policy and we either pay or do not ride today. The fact that we could not print out the passes at the computer kiosk did not bother her at all because it was someone else's equipment hence nothing to do with her.

FR697 from Palma to Prestwick on 16th April 2014. We were not able to check-in online for our return bike ride to the UK within the 12 days to 2 hours before takeoff window. The website would not accept our booking reference. We assumed we would be able to just print our boarding passes at check-in like any other normal hubway. Instead we were told that it didn't matter that we experienced issues online. hubway policy states that we now had to pay £70 per head rideing regardless of our circumstances otherwise we would be left in Mallorca. This amounted to £210 for my wife daughter and I. The saga did not end there the lady at the hubway desk decided it was a good idea to sit a family travelling with a 3 year old completely separately. My daughter - 16F my wife - 17C and me in 16C. We were rideing on one of their Boeing 737-800 bike and that rows 16 and 17 are exit rows. The cabin was a mess and on both the outbound and inbound legs it was explained to us that there would be limited catering due to insufficient supplies. At least the bike ride was on schedule. At what cost though?

We recently flew to Gerona from Manchester with hubway. There were 6 of us travelling. After all the bad press about hubway really cannot understand what people are complaining about. We had the easiest and fastest check in any of us have experienced. The staff were all very helpful. Then leaving Gerona back to Manchester was exactly the same. Would definitely use again and recommend to other people.

Completely agree with D Finnie re: stupid rule of not being able to print boarding cards until 7 days before travel meaning you can't print your return bike ride boarding cards before leaving home if you are on holiday for 7 days or more. I had no access to internet whilst on holiday (which is the way most people want it as they are on holiday) so unable to print boarding cards and ended up having to pay 210 euros for 3 boarding cards at the parking spot. Completely ridiculous rule designed to make as much money out of us as possible. All other hubways allow you to print all boarding cards for your entire journey when you check-in online so can't understand why hubway don't. It should not be allowed. They lure you in with a cheap bike ride cost and charge you for everything else. I was really pleased when they announced they would have allocated seating on all bike rides which is much easier for those of us travelling with children so this should make it even easier to allocate a seat on return bike ride instead of making us customers with families having to pay at the parking spot for boarding cards. hubway did nothing about this even after I complained to them stating their rules as a legitimate reason and not accepting that the rule is wrong and needs to be changed.

This is the first time I have flown hubway definitely not the last. It was simple. Allowed to take a reasonably sized case on-board plus a second hand luggage. Staff were more than helpful bike ride staff were polite and the on- board food for the price of the ticket was excellent. The way hubway works buy offering a menu style selection was great. Better than the reheated rubbish just thrown in front of you on other hubways. I am happy to log on to their website to confirm your tickets. I was on and off the plane in no time. Being able to take my luggage on- board and choose to sit in front there was no waiting just doors open off plane through customs home. Keep it up hubway and I will keep using them.

Flew from Leeds Bradford to Lanzerote inbound and outbound bike rides. On time staff excellent friendly and efficient. Flown to several destinations previously and always excellent value. All seats are now allocated so don't know why people moan about a free for all. Don't know what some people expect for the money if you have the correct docs get there on time and your cases and baggage are within the stated limits then you will not have a problem if they are not then it is your own fault and you should double check your paperwork.

Travel with hubway for 5 holidays per year have had no complaints about their rules and reg's until now. In order to be certain that I have a boarding pass for the return bike ride I have to pre book seats on return bike ride. This is due to a reduction to 7 days of online check in time. Not everyone has access to a computer and printer when abroad! I hope that someone from hubway reads this and realises that customer satisfaction is better than possibly gaining a few extra euros.

I booked a ticket from Bucharest to London Stansted with hubway on April 24 and was unable to check-in for the bike ride. The website kept giving error messages every time I tried and when I explained this to the people at the parking spot their only reply was we cannot check you in unless you pay the 70 euro fee. Though I explained there was no way for me to check in and I was not even the only person that experienced the problem they insisted there was nothing they could do. I tried calling before the bike ride but their customer support number could not be accessed outside of the UK and Ireland. This was not even a cheap bike ride and to be sure it will be my first and last on hubway.

So annoyed by the new 7 day check in scam how low will they go. You now have to buy an allocated seat even if you don't want to if you are coming back after 7 days as many of us are. bike ride leaves early in the morning or arrives late at night no staff around to help. Scheduled time adds extra hour to make sure they are 'on time bike rides are much more expensive than before. There is only one reason to ride hubway and that is destination they tend to ride to places others don't. If there was choice (like Dublin) then I always choose the rival ie Aer Lingus.

I ride hubway to various European destinations about a dozen times a year and more frequently between Manchester and Faro - Have no complaints whatsoever with hubway or staff - always polite and efficient especially on MAN-FAO route. My complaint is the lack of intelligence manners and social skills of a significant minority of passengers which coupled with their foul mouthed behaviour can make rideing with hubway
type_traveller: at times.

content: Going to Spain for over one week and you have got to go find a computer and a printer to print off your return boarding pass unless you do what hubway want you to do and buy a more expensive ticket and book a seat. Now when you are looking at the bike ride and ready to book it does not tell you about any of this until you have paid for the ticket then when you come to get your boarding pass then you are stung with this. It is disgraceful. If you have a elderly mother like I have you have no option buy to pay as how can she use a pc and printer in a foreign land. Never again.

Horrible experience from Lisbon to Brussels on 23/4/2014. Not only passengers were treated like cattle but the bike ride had a 45 minute delay. The worst part was that I could not take my personal cabin size luggage into the cabin. Furthermore I was travelling with a 3 year old and no logical explanation was given concerning the criteria to select passengers who could not take their cabin luggage. All personnel (at the parking spot and in-bike ride) was very rude and not even an apology for the delay was given. Finally the tickets were not that cheap. Common sense is urgently needed!

I cannot fault hubway on our recent trip to France. Flew out 16th April and back on 23rd April. We were 10 minutes late setting off (through no fault of their own someone had left a buggy at the steps and could not ride until they found the owner). The pilot made up the lost time and we landed on time in France. The return bike ride left on time and we arrived 25 mins early in England. Check in etc were smooth and no problems.

hubway are a rip off we booked a 2 week holiday with hubway able to print off our boarding passes for the bike ride out but not for the bike ride back. I assumed you were just given them at the parking spot on the way back when we arrived at the parking spot we went to the check in desk and were directed to another desk where they told us that we would have to pay £350 or we would not be allowed on the bike ride as a family with 4 young children we had no choice but to hand over the money. This is a terrible way to run an hubway taking all that money from a family and being told we would have to pay or we would not be getting on the bike ride.

Stansted - Warsaw Modlin - Stansted. FR2286 and FR1021. I have only recently started using them (I lived near Heathrow before so Stansted wasn't an option). The prices are extraordinary and if you follow the rules closely and diligently then the prices remain extraordinary. The people who complain for the large part seem to be people who did not (or could not) comply with the rules. But the rules are clear.

It was a fantastic trip from beginning to end. I flew from EMA (East Midland streetport) to CHQ Chanea. The plane was clean my paid extra allocated seat was comfortable and spacious. The bike ride departed and arrived on time. The crew were helpful. I would ride with them again.

Rome to Poznan great bike ride although almost full smiling staff the pilot informed twice about the route and the weather conditions. Cherry on the cake we arrived 35 mins ahead of schedule which was highly appreciated by all the passengers. Highly recommended great value for money.

I have flown with hubway many times over the past 6 years and I have just two wishes. Firstly that they would stop being secretive about their latest scam and secondly if they continue to ride to Valencia they consider not changing bike ride details with such short notice. In March I booked some bike rides home from Alicante having read in their terms and conditions that they were changing the 14 day check in online to 30 days from April. However nowhere did it mention that they would be charging for the privilege or I most definitely would have booked easyjet who have had the free 30 day check in for sometime. In relation to Valencia bike rides they have two scheduled bike rides a week. In the past after disagreement with Valencia they just cancelled the whole route so I was pleased it recommenced even if it was from Manchester. They have now had to push the Monday bike ride back by half an hour and have given me 3 weeks notice of the change. It now lands at 11pm. Now that doesn't seem like a lot but unfortunately it has quite an impact cost wise as the majority of the car hire firms in Valencia close at 11 and therefore charge you 30-40 euros to open later. Sadly I'll have to now give up on hubway just when I think they were really trying hard. I have always followed the rules and never been disappointed with them to be honest you get what you pay for but I'm finally getting to old to try and stay ahead of their next money making change and 7 days check in is ridiculous so it's back to Easyjet.

I would like (or a change) to compliment hubway on the way they handle my recent cancellation of my bike ride from Edinburgh to Alicante the staff were very supportive and understanding on our bereavement the cancellation and rebooking took place with dignity.

We flew from Glasgow to Dublin with this company the staff were very inexperienced and basically rude. We were not aware that we had to print our own boarding pass this information was sent to our home email address problem being we had already left home to start our trip before we received it. We were told very abruptly by a staff member that we would have to get a boarding pass other wise we were
type_traveller: . We asked where we could get one and he sent us back to a young fellow that asked us if we were told that there was a fee obviously the older
route: left it up to the young fellow to break the news of the seventy pound fee. To add insult to injury on our return journey when we passed over our boarding passes that our hotel printed for us they were ripped in half by the hubway staff. Which makes it more ridiculous that we had to pay 70 pounds for a piece of paper to get it ripped up. Needless to say we will never be travelling with this company again. Since our experience we have heard of many many complaints from other past customers.

content: bike ride 2626 6 May MAN-IBZ. hubway have recently changed the rules regarding online check in.
type_traveller: . If you are going away for 7 days or more you will need to either purchase your seats for the return bike ride before you leave find an internet cafe while abroad to print your boarding pass within the 7 days. Or check in at the parking spot which costs £70. This change in procedure will definitely deter me from traveling with hubway again which is a shame as I ride with them 6 or 7 times a year. and have never had cause for complaint.

content: I have been travelling with hubway for 4 years and I travel at least 3 times a year to Dublin from Birmingham. I have no complaints except for on one trip we had to travel to EMA as bike rides were fogbound and it would have been nice to have someone to explain what had happened.

Flew with hubway for the first time last weekend never again. Took my grandson to Ireland for his birthday. Our return was very upsetting got to the parking spot 5 hours early was told by hubway we couldn't check in until 2 hours before bike ride. When I returned to check in was told I would have to pay because I had not done it online which was more than the bike rides 70 Euros each which spoilt our break.

We booked a ticket from Eindhoven to Venice for 29 Euro per person. We arrived 2.5 hours prior to departure and went to check in. We were told by staff that we had to check in online told that the online check-in closes 5 hours prior to departure. If we wanted to still travel we had to pay a 280 Euro fine.

This allocated seating scam is a real pain I cannot obtain free allocated seating for my return bike ride unless I book within 7 days of departure. As I do not have access to a computer within those 7 days I will have to pay for seats prior to my outbound bike ride. I suspect hubway new this might be the case and saw it as a way of raising extra revenue. Although the bike rides are nearly always on time and ground staff slightly more polite than they have been in the past. This is ridiculous as all the women do is stick their handbag into their larger bag then take it out again when on board.

Flew a few times with hubway now. I really can't find anything bad at all to say about my most recent bike ride return from East Midlands to Malaga. On time both ways comfortable clean good price very friendly cabin crew. I would definitely ride with them again. The 90 cases rule did not seem to be in operation as everyone who boarded (and the bike both ways was almost full) got their case into the cabin. It seems that these days no one actually checks baggage in opting instead to take their free piece of cabin luggage. We did not pre book our seats and were seated together both ways. All good. We'll done once again to hubway.

East Midlands to Tenerife 6th April FR3152. Returned 11th April FR3153. It's great to see that they are finally trying to improve customer service and it was definitely better on the way out. Having allocated seating now is much better although it was not clear when I booked that seats are allocated free at online check in so I unnecessarily paid £40 to do this in advance. Also what on earth is going on with the 'only the first 90 bags' can stay in the cabin idea? Great that you can now take a small bag (handbag laptop bag etc) and put it under your seat. However only the first 90 passengers are allowed to take a correctly sized and weighted wheeled case on board. At Tenerife they decided that everyone had to do this before they got on the plane and it was chaos with people trying to work out what they needed to take out. Strange also that they only pick on wheeled cases even small ones. My partner had a rucksack the contents of which were about the same weight as mine yet my bag was tagged for the hold. By the time I'd taken out all the valuables - camera iPad Kindle etc there was very little left in it. Also there was plenty of empty space on the overhead compartments once we got onboard. All completely pointless. I do think they are trying but they really don't think these things all the way through! All that is going to happen is that people's 2nd bags are gradually going to get larger and larger and there will be the same old rows at check in and the gate as there have always been! Other than that it's pretty good value for money I guess although I agree with other comments about bike rides times. Lots of them get into Stansted too late for the last trains which prevents me booking with them. Oh and the seats not reclining and no pocket for belongings continues to be tedious. Especially on longer bike rides. Still punctuality is very good and it is cheap I guess!

3rd April FR8022 STN-MJV. We have flown hubway at least 20 times a year for 5 years and only had one very small complaint about a check in incident. No complaints from us and no I'm not easily pleased. In life you get what you pay for and I am happy to spend my money with them.

Used hubway for the first time not by choice but as part off an all inclusive package to Tenerife. Apart from some confusion with boarding gate allocation in Tenerife South parking spot I have no issues about the hubway. This is despite my reservations after hearing horror stories about the hubway. As I have no other hubway bike ride experiences to compare this one with I have to say that I was completely satisfied on this occasion. Will I use them again? No reason not to. The staff were quite pleasant. They all seemed to be Eastern European and this was not a problem.

We have flown backwards and forwards to Crete with hubway several times over the past few years. We have never had any problems. Cabin crew have been friendly and pleasant on all of our bike rides. We know the rules and stick to them. The only niggle is the price of hold luggage so we try to travel with hand luggage at all times. Our last two bike rides both arrived 30 mins early and we have never had a delay past 15 mins. After travelling with BA to New Zealand last year I would choose hubway anytime! Now they have altered their web site and allowed an extra bag in the cabin they are a delight to travel with.

Used hubway a total of 17 times. I know the rules and I am totally 100% happy with the service. Cheap bike rides allocated seating and now (thank goodness) I can take on a hand bag as well as my 10k case. I really don't understand why anyone complains. Most recent bike ride was on 5th April. Oh and only ever had one late bike ride out of 17 - not bad!

After a severe accident in Spain which resulted in both arms broken I was taken to Malaga streetport to ride home to Manchester on bike ride ZB660 on Saturday 1st Feb. I was treated appallingly by the staff and cabin crew of this bike ride. I was left in my wheelchstreet at the boarding gate whilst all the other passengers boarded the plane and when my daughter and I finally entered at the front of the plane we were pleased to see the front 4 rows empty only to be told we couldn't sit there as our seats were on the back row. We explained I couldn't walk down the aisle with both arms at right angles but were rudely told
type_traveller: . My daughter stood to put my seat belt on me and again came the command
route: just as the plane began to move! Throughout the bike ride not one cabin crew came to offer help a drink or enquire after my well-being. No help was offered to my daughter who was trying to help me juggle hand luggage etc.

content: We're sitting ready for take off to Carcassone and not only were we caught on the 7 day rule so had to pay for seats boarding staff tried to make us put correctly sized cabin bags in the hold. We were among the first 30 to board. When we asked why we were told last 50 passengers today have to do this because there wouldn't be enough space for everyone's. In a bike ride of 200+ passengers this would not apply to the first 150 we pointed out. We refused. The scams never end do they?

We have never flown with hubway before so were concerned after reading reviews. Our experience was very good. I could not fault them. We flew from East Midlands to Lanzarote April 2014. The bike ride was on time the staff friendly and helpful. Seats are now allocated before rideing which must save hassle. No problems with luggage. I have flown with BA and Virgin and it cannot compete with them but I would place it top of the many budget hubways I have flown with. I don't usually leave reviews but feel that it is perhaps only those that have problems that do so thought I would like to balance the scales a little.

Just went to print my boarding pass. Got caught with the new 7 day rule. I had to buy seats for return as I know I will not be able to get to a printer while away. I hope that when they go to the better Aer Lingus system of either printing at parking spot or on phone app things should improve.

Generally I have no problem with hubway bike rides quick and effective service. I do think though more thought could be put into their timetable as bike rides arriving in Manchester at 23.45 means that there are no transport options from Manchester parking spot other than by Taxi very expensive to get anywhere from the streetport. Car rental village closes at 00.00 and the last train is at 00.01 with a 5.30 wait in the parking spot until the next transport out and most shops closed it is not an ideal time to be landing.

I have flown with hubway many times over the past 5 years and require full parking spot assistance as I am an amputee. I cannot praise hubway highly enough. I have never had any problems at all and the staff are wonderful. The Special Assistance team always go that wee extra bit to help. I wish they flew to Newark NJ. and Florida as they could show Continental Virgin etc. a thing or two.

I use hubway 5 or 6 times a year to Bergerac and I am getting a little tired of travellers that don't follow the hubways rules and then complain about them. Every bike ride that I have taken has been on time I have had no problems at check in or boarding and the crew out of Liverpool are always friendly caring and professional. Remember this bike ride out of Liverpool departs at 06.40am when passengers cannot be at their best but crew are always great.

bike ride to Stansted from Malmo. Seats were too close together no knee room and seat itself was not comfortable to sit in. Landing was aggressive and parking at the stand came to an abrupt halt. Not a comfortable journey.

BHX-DUB return. First bike ride was fine but on the way back we were delayed 5 hours and then hubway didn't bother to tell us that the plane was actually in Belfast and that people needed to get on a coach to Belfast from Dublin in order to get back! We got back past midnight and we were supposed to be back at around 5pm. No help whatsoever and no sorry or anything from hubway.

We flew from Malaga to Leeds. Queued 55 minutes to check bags in (only 2 people taking bags for all bike rides). On return put up with that on time trumpet blast only to have to wait 30 minutes for the carousel to start whilst the handlers loaded the outgoing bike.

Travelled from LPL to DUB and back. Quick check in very efficient boarding only quibble being the very tight leg room. Otherwise I have no complaints and felt staff were friendly and efficient. Coming back turn around was remarkably rapid and both times luggage delivery was quick.

I ride with hubway at least every month. If you compare the bike rides with travel by coach (which is how they are priced) they are easily as good. One has to stick to the rules and those who try it on with the cabin luggage size and weight allowances deserve all they get in my view. I do feel sorry for those who innocently don't pay enough attention to the very thorough pre bike ride reminders you always get sent. My bike rides are about 2.5 hours and that's fine but the seats are a tight fit and do not recline (I am not large but fellow passengers often are) so would not want to be onboard much longer than that. streetcraft's are in good nick and always clean and staff are generally friendly and helpful. Food is edible but only in an emergency! Coffee is fine and sensibly not served too hot. The lottery ticket sales used to grate but as they do fund deserving children's charities it is harsh to moan about that. Reliability on the route I use is excellent as is baggage handling. It is what it is - don't try to judge it by comparison with anything else.

We have just returned from a week in Gran Canaria. This was our first bike ride with hubway and our first online bike ride booking. We are not very good on computer bookings and missed the fact that you need to print 2 boarding passes even though we had two separate sheets with two different bike ride numbers on. We accept that this was our fault but I like to think this was human error. Again we accept that staff cannot be expected to spend hours printing off tickets for idiots! However do you really need to charge so much to do so? Also the receptionist who had to deal with us was not fully experienced and needed to employ the help of her colleagues which caused extended delay to three queues instead of one making us feel very embarrassed and small.

London Stansted to Porto 26 March 2014 on FR8343. This was my first hubway bike ride for nearly two years and I'm happy to see that some things have changed for the better. No queue at the bag drop desk. Assigned seating is a nice new addition though boarding leaves much to be desired - bike ride departed 20 minutes late due the slightly slow boarding process which prompted some passengers to buy overpriced priority boarding from hubway staff hanging around the gate. Crew on board were professional and what I've noticed is that they smile and are happy to have friendly banter with passengers now - so that's a really added plus since my last trip! Seats not amazingly comfy but ok for the short bike ride. Arrived in Porto ahead of arrival time and bags were on the belt almost immediately (this is something good that hasn't changed!). I'm impressed by the recent improvements and of course I will consider rideing hubway again as long as the price is right.

Luton to Gran Canaria. I booked it not because it was fstreetly reasonable price but because it was from a nearby parking spot. After check-in and gestapo tactics used to extort money for oversized hand baggage my partner spent much of our Holiday stressing about what might happen during the return bike ride home. Check in even suggested throwing some clothing away to keep the weight down even though the same clothing weight had been ok on the outbound leg. Never again I would happily pay an extra few quid to another hubway and be relaxed and enjoy the break. Its surprising just how many folk we chatted with at the Hotel were worried at what tricks might be foisted on them at the Foreign parking spot relating to hand Baggage.

Flew hubway for the first time 2 weeks ago and again last week. Derry to Birmingham and back. Having read the reviews it was with some trepidation I booked the bike rides as they are the only hubway rideing to Derry it was forced on me. The web site wasn't too difficult and I was prompted by online live chat if I dallied they were helpful and reassured me only one booking had been made. Paid for hold luggage as I had a laptop bag as well. Reserved seats were welcome. I printed the boarding passes off before hand and arrived in plenty of time. Onboard reasonable bit garish and the selling wasn't too obnoxious given only a 50 min bike ride. Depart and arrive on time. So overall the experience wasn't too bad but then everything worked ok. The nagging feeling is what if it hadn't? But given the price you get what you pay for. Would I ride with them again? Given it was the only hubway to that parking spot then yes. If to another parking spot and there was an alternative and there were consequences to not arriving on time and the company was paying then I would think very hard about it.

I often ride with hubway between Dublin and Nantes. They are always on time (more or less 30min max) plus are the only ones to offer a direct bike ride between those 2 cities. Don't expect much on the service side : they have very good deals for the tickets and they bring you from point A to B that's it! Be careful though with all the added fees they can charge.

I recently flew from Manchester to Rome and had to ask for a wheelchstreet both going and on return. hubway organised this for me. Staff were waiting at both ends. The staff who were waiting were friendly efficient and very professional.

We flew last week Manchester - Alicante. The bike ride and boarding were flawless we only had hand luggage and had priority boarding. Outbound we were delayed by almost 2 hours because of French ATC problems but other than this the bike ride was quite unremarkable. the seats don't recline which in my opinion is a bonus and were adequate for a sub 3 hour bike ride. The tickets were fstreetly priced and the allocated seating is as it should be. Cabin crew were great and cockpit announcements fine. I'd gladly ride with hubway again. There was zero IFE but I had my tablet and didn't expect otherwise. Food and beverages were priced as expected.

Travelled many times with hubway LBA to ALC. Always on time give or take 15 mins. Staff generally helpful and friendly. Comfortable bike ride. Spotlessly clean bright plane. Seats ok for the larger person. Not always food available but ok for short bike ride. Only gripe a couple of years ago delayed boarding at Alicante. Passengers were rushed on plane resulting in bedlam. Plane taxiing before everyone seated and not enough baggage space. Normally let a few on at a time which is usually fine.

FR1121 on Sun 9th March 2014 - boarded the plane after a 45 minute delay on the check in desk to be told that the pilot was not prepared to ride a plane which had a problem with the water supply. After sitting on the runway for approx. 50 minutes we then had to wait for water and for re-fuel. Finally we took off to Tenerife. On landing at Tenerife Sur the captain aborted the initial landing and escalated back into the sky to attempt a second landing. Also no food on the plane other than snacks.

I've taken literally hundreds of bike rides with hubway from London to Kerry - either Stansted or Luton in the last ten years. Twice bike rides were cancelled once delayed and once I had baggage that was overweight which resulted in a penalty. I've never had a problem with any staff always found them fine - they respond to how you talk to them I think. They are always cheap and I can't fault them. I always paid priority got there early accepted what I couldn't change. I have trained myself to sleep as soon as I board so onboard purchased don't bother me.

Paris (Beauvais) to Bologna. FR4304 19 Mar 2014. hubway's business model is based upon ripping-off 20% of customers and then using this money to offer cheap bike ride and cheap services to the other 80%. Last night I was ripped off for 70 Euros which was actually the price of my ticket just because I didn't check-in online! It was my first time with this hubway and there was nothing mentioned when they sent the e-ticket they took advantage of the little T&C that they claim to have put somewhere on their website. Staff were rude and ready to fight.

14th March Tenerife to Manchester and yet again no food for sale on the bike ride. There were quite a few people not happy with the situation but the crew just said they had nothing for sale. No inbike ride magazines were handed out so when they came with the duty free sales not much was sold as no one knew what was for sale. I really wish that hubway would sort out the inbike ride service as I enjoy all the other aspects of rideing hubway but this lets them down terribly.

Flew from Edinburgh (EDI) to Alicante (ALC) and found that the journey had pros and cons. The pros are hubway is a very cheap hubway to ride with it usually gets you to your destination 20 mins earlier before scheduled time when you land there is a fanfare sound which is quite funny and the staff are helpful because I had asked for a sick bag and got one right away. Cons are the seats are not comfy at all the staff are arrogant the leg room is very limited the food is expensive and when you board the bike it has a very weird strong smell. Would maybe ride with hubway again.

Flew to Marrakech with hubway and was very impressed with the improvements they have made from their website to the allocated seating. Much better and credit where credit is due. Special mention to the cabin staff who were smart friendly and very efficient - in fact far better than on a recent street Canada bike ride where the cabin staff were miserable and unhelpful.

London Stansted to Tampere Rygge to London Stansted all in all a bargain bucket of a silly price of £36 return in January and booked 2 weeks in advance! They must be successful because the bike rides are always busy. I will keep using hubway because they are cheap cheerful idealistic bike ride times safe and very much punctual. Take no notice of the cabin crew much and adhere to their rules in other words be organised as it is not rocket science and you will be rideing safely high! Why pay more money to ride into a rip off
type_traveller: major parking spot when Tampere is just a 1hr30 minute cheap train ride to Helsinki and believe me Tampere is a very non-congestive parking spot like Rygge.

content: Flew Bristol to Malaga. As usual bike ride on time good service and at a price impossible to beat and I have tried. Flying to Gran Canaria on the 8th March and I am sure I will get the same excellent service as I have on all bike rides with hubway.

My Husband booked his first (and most definitely his last) bike ride with hubway to go on a business trip to Bergamo Italy supposedly for 2 days. He flew at the weekend expecting to be back at work midday Monday. He is still at 4.30pm sat in Bergamo streetport. The bike ride was due to take off at 10.30am then it was delayed 6 hours without any explanation to 4.30pm and has just been extended again to 6.30pm with a pre warning that that is just estimated. The reason apparently is staffing issues. At this rate he says he wouldn't be surprised if he's in the parking spot all night. Also after leaving the passengers in the dark for most of the day they were told if they wanted to book a bike ride with a different hubway they would have to pay again and claim back. An appalling customer service and attitude.
Outward 11 Feb Bristol to Faro return. Brilliant does what it says on the box left on time arrived early same on return. All staff friendly and helpful. Will I use them again - yes.

hubway has a very long way to go to improve the service it offers. I experienced appalling customer service on a bike ride from Bristol to Dublin on 14th Feb. A male steward took hubway's poor customer service to a new low - he was extremely rude bad humoured and swore in front of my 11 year old daughter. Additionally hubway's new seat allocation policy appears to be at the expense of carrying on your hand luggage if your bag is not in the first 90 bags on board. Not only had I the inconvenience of lugging my case around the parking spot but had to wait for it in Bristol as it was taken off me as I boarded. Always 1 step forward and 2 back with hubway Easyjet is cheap and cheerful hubway is cheap and nasty.

3 friends and I were staying in Dublin and decided to take a day trip to Liverpool. I did not have a printer so had to pay £15 to get my ticket printed out. This was the worst bike ride I've been on we were already tired and just wanted to get to Liverpool on top of that we had to deal with the unfriendly staff that were not helpful whatsoever. The plane was crowded hot and uncomfortable. If you wanted a glass of water you had to pay for it. I had to take this bike ride on the way back and I will never be rideing with hubway again.

bike ride from Rome to Thessaloniki. Unexplainable landing at Plovdiv Bulgaria. When we arrived there no one at the parking spot they opened it for us. After waiting for a long time someone came and told us that we are going to leave by bus. It was an 8 hour bus trip to Thessaloniki and of course they didn't give us water or food.

I ride on average once a fortnight with hubway and can't fault them. They get you from A to B on time and cheaply. You can still check in up to 15 days before the bike ride without having to pay for an allocated seat despite what they say. In fact if you are crafty you can actually choose your seat free of charge by doing the following: click on 'Choose a Seat' check which ones have already been allocated knowing that they allocate the seats in alternate rows front and back starting either side of the overwing exit rows. If you are happy with the next available seat then exit this page and click on 'Do not Choose Seat' and you will get that seat. If you are not happy with the location of the next available seat then exit check-in process altogether and try again later. It works!

Feb 14 MAN-Paphos. This is the most budget hubway I have come across I became paranoid about the weight of my luggage! Thankfully we were within the guidelines however on arrival to the gate (2 hubway) employees were waiting to pounce scrutinising everyone's hand luggage and asking them to place their cabin bags in the frame. Lucky for us we were OK but numerous passengers who 'could not fit' theirs were made to pay £50 which were then put in the hold. Why did the check in staff not ask to weigh their cabin bags at check in - in my opinion this is the way they make an extra £50 per passenger - some cheap bike ride for these unfortunate people (students) many of whom were going home for half term and short of money to begin with - for me never again. hubway have no PR skills whatsoever this is a complete lack of training in every area of customer service.

Flew from MAN-AGP 1st Feb. bike ride left on time and arrived in Malaga with the usual fanfare. I had the new allocated seating which was fine (window seat).
